  • Alternatively, Rotom-H can also opt between Thunderbolt or Dark Pulse as offensive move selections over Will-O-Wisp, which can be somewhat awkward with choice lock. Thunderbolt gives Rotom-H a repeatable Electric-type STAB that doesn't force it to switch, and Dark Pulse helps it get important coverage against various Pokemon that resist both of its STAB types, such as Dragapult.

Items

  • Choice Scarf allows Rotom-H to outspeed major threats, such as Dragapult and Choice Scarf Dracovish. It also punishes defensive Pokemon more with Trick.

  • Choice Specs gives Rotom-H much more power.

EV spreads

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe Timid: This spread maximizes speed and power for Choice Scarf.

  • 68 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 12 SpD / 172 Spe Modest: This spread gives Rotom-H some bulk while maximizing Special Attack and outspeeding Adamant Choice Band Dracovish and slower variants of Zapdos.

Bulky Baking Oven.description:
• Rotom-H without a choice item can seamlessly play both a potent Dynamax role and a useful supporting role in one set.

  • Nasty Plot in combination with Electric STAB options allow it to check all variants of Zapdos, but can be replaced by Volt Switch if equipping an Assault Vest.

  • For the last slot, Rotom-H can use Dark Pulse to hit many targets that resist its dual STAB, and can also gain access to Max Darkness, dropping foes' Special Defense. It can also opt for running Will-O-Wisp to gain the upper hand against physical attackers.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry gives Rotom-H a quick burst of recovery that can turn potential 2HKOs into 3HKOs, with th most notable one being turning Zapdos's Life Orb Max Lightning into a 3HKO after Stealth Rock against maximum HP Rotom-H.

  • Assault Vest gives Rotom-H plenty of special bulk to better check special threats, and it works particulary well with Dynamax.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 SpD Modest: This spread forgoes Speed investment to maximize Rotom-H's HP.

  • 68 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 12 SpD / 172 Spe Modest: This spread gives Rotom-H bulk, maximizes Special Attack, and outspeeds Adamant Choice Band Dracovish and slower variants of Zapdos.

Rotom-Wash.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A- Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are fantastic in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame, and can sweep, support, or wall significant portions of the metagame. These Pokemon require less support than most others to be used effectively and have few flaws that can easily be overlooked when compared to their positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Choice Attacker.description:
• With access to Volt Switch and Trick, Rotom-W makes for a great choiced pivot in the metagame.

  • Thunderbolt gives Rotom-W an Electric-type STAB it can stay in with without Dynamaxing, but Dark Pulse lets Rotom-W deal good damage to Dragapult switch-ins, and is the most damage it can do against Naganadel switch-ins.

Items

  • Choice Specs gives Rotom-W a much needed power boost.

  • Choice Scarf is still a good option to let Rotom-W outspeed important threats such as Landorus-T and Dragapult.

EV Spreads

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest or Timid: This spread maximizes Rotom-W's power and speed. Modest is prefered for damage output, but Timid does outspeed Modest Galarian Moltres.

  • 92 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 12 SpD / 148 Spe with Modest: This is a slightly bulkier spread that ensures Choice Specs Rotom-W outspeeds Timid Celesteela.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 SpD with Modest: This spread maximizes power and bulk for Choice Specs Rotom-W.

Bulky.description:
• Rotom-Wash's typing is a good fit for a bulky attacker. Discharge gives Rotom-W a higher chance to paralyze foes, while Thunderbolt offers more power and can be a better fit with Will-O-Wisp.

  • Will-O-Wisp allows Rotom-W to effectively cripple physical attackers.

  • If using Assault Vest, Dark Pulse is the most damage Rotom-W can do to Dragapult and Naganadel.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry gives Rotom-W a quick burst of recovery, which is important against powerful foes such as Cinderace.

  • Assault Vest gives Rotom-W a lot of special bulk, especially if it Dynamaxes.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 92 SpA / 12 SpD / 148 Spe with Modest: This spread allows Rotom-W to outspeed Timid Celesteela, while offering good bulk and decent power.

  • 252 HP / 108 Def / 148 Spe with Bold: This spread maximizes Rotom-W's physical bulk while still outspeeding Timid Celesteela.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Bold: This spread gives Rotom-W the maximum physical defense possible.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 SpD with Modest: This spread maximizes Rotom-W's bulk and power.

Nasty Plot.description:
• Rotom-W makes a shockingly good user of Nasty Plot, with high base power moves and good coverage.

  • Dark Pulse ensures that Dragapult and Naganadel don't wall Rotom-W, and is an excellent fit while Dynamaxed with Max Darkness lowering foes' Special Defense.

  • Volt Switch lets Rotom-W be a good pivot when it can't set up Nasty Plot.

  • Will-O-Wisp allows Rotom-W to cripple physical attackers, and act more as a general bulky set if setting up Nasty Plot doesn't make sense.

  • Substitute lets Rotom-W set up on common status users such as Swampert, Celesteela, and Hippowdon that lack Whirlwind.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry gives Rotom-W a quick burst of recovery.

  • Leftovers is a good option if using Substitute, gradually letting Rotom-W regain its health back against passive Pokemon.

  • Chesto Berry + Rest can also be an effective option against Hippowdon leads.

EV Spreads

  • 92 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 12 SpD / 148 Spe with Modest: This spread allows Rotom-W to outspeed Timid Celesteela, while maximizing its power.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 92 SpA / 12 SpD / 148 Spe with Modest: This spread makes Rotom-W more like its bulky set, while still giving it enough power to be a threat with Nasty Plot.

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest or Timid: This spread maximizes Rotom-W's Speed and power. Modest is still prefered for damage output, but Timid does allow Rotom-W to outspeed Modest Galarian Moltres.

Dialga.overview: These sets are for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Offensive Support.description:
Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash allows Dialga to survive moves it'd normally have no hope of without Dynamax, such as Life Orb Yveltal's Max Darkness and Zacian-C's Close Combat.

  • Chople Berry: Chople Berry lets Dialga survive Zacian-C's Close Combat.

EV Spreads

  • 196 HP / 252 SpA / 60 Spe: This EV spread allows Dialga to outspeed up to Choice Scarf Kyogre after paralysis.

  • 140 HP / 252 SpA / 116 Spe: This EV spread lets Dialga outpeed up to +1 paralyzed Timid Yveltal.

Palkia.overview: This set is for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Heatran.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are fantastic in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame, and can sweep, support, or wall significant portions of the metagame. These Pokemon require less support than most others to be used effectively and have few flaws that can easily be overlooked when compared to their positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Offensive.description:
• Heatran's impressive typing, coverage, and offensive stats make it an excellent candidate for Dynamax.

  • Lava Plume is a reliable Fire-type STAB that has a good chance to burn your foes. Magma Storm isn't entirely reliable, but trapping opposing Pokemon can be quite useful.

  • Solar Beam offers valuable coverage against Water-types such as Tapu Fini and Rotom-W while Dynamaxed, and it even skips the charge turn if Heatran set up the Sun with Max Flare earlier.

Items

  • Assault Vest makes Heatran very difficult to OHKO on the special side, especially when Dynamaxed.

  • Air Balloon limits Ground-type Pokemon's initial options against Heatran.

EV Spreads

  • 20 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 12 SpD / 220 Spe with Modest: This EV spread allows Heatran to outspeed Timid Celesteela, and avoid a Special Attack boost from Porygon2's Download.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 Spe with Modest: This EV spread maximizes Heatran's bulk and power.

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This EV spread maximizes Heatran's power and Speed, potentially letting it outspeed Pokemon that don't always maximize their Speed, such as Rillaboom and Tapu Fini.

Stealth Rock Setter.description:
• Heatran's good bulk and typing make it a natural candidate for setting up Stealth Rock.

  • Lava Plume is a reliable option with a good chance to burn, while Magma Storm's ability to trap foes is great for restricting options, at the cost of reliable accuracy.

  • Flash Cannon lets Heatran hit Fairy-types hard and is an incredible option for Dynamax attacking due to Max Steelspike.

  • If bulky Water-types are an issue, Solar Beam is a reasonable option provided you are willing to Dynamax Heatran.

  • Taunt allows Heatran to gain an advantage over more defensive foes such as Porygon2 and Celesteela.

  • Will-O-Wisp is quite useful for crippling physical attackers that may switch-in such as Assault Vest Landorus-T.

Items

  • Air Balloon gives Heatran a good match-up against Ground-types early in the game, letting it set up Stealth Rock or Taunt easily.

  • Leftovers is a reasonable alternative for keeping Heatran healthy if using a bulkier set.

EV Spreads

  • 20 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 12 SpD / 220 Spe with Modest: This spread allows Heatran to outspeed Timid Celesteela and avoid a Special Attack boost from Porygon2's Download.

  • 252 HP / 36 SpD / 220 Spe with Calm: In addition to outspeeding Timid Celesteela, this Heatran focuses on being as bulky as possible.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 Spe with Modest: This EV spread maximizes Heatran's bulk and power.

Victini.overview: These sets are for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Choice Scarf.description:
EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 252 Spe: Maximizing HP allows Victini to OHKO support Groudon and other base 100 HP foes.

  • 228 HP / 92 Atk / 188 Spe: This spread allows Victini to outspeed Landorus-T and OHKO Zacian-C with V-create.

Focus Sash.description:
EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 252 Spe: Maximum HP ensures that Victini can OHKO the many base 100 HP foes, such as Groudon and Kyogre.

  • 228 HP / 92 Atk / 188 Spe: This spread prioritizes OHKOing Zacian-C with V-create, and outspeeding Landorus-T.

  • 252 Atk / 4 SpD / 252 Spe: If not using Final Gambit, this spread is useful for maximizing the power of V-create.

Excadrill.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Offensive Support.description:
• With Mold Breaker and an excellent typing, Excadrill has the tools to deal with major threats, such as Mimikyu and Rotom-W.

  • Rock Tomb is essential for providing Speed control.

  • If using Focus Sash, Excadrill is a good choice for setting up Stealth Rock.

  • Horn Drill gives Excadrill a 30% chance to bust through defensive Pokemon that would otherwise wall it, such as Celesteela.

  • Swords Dance lets Excadrill take advantage of more passive threats, such as Cresselia. If using Assault Vest, Brick Break is a reasonable replacement while Dynamaxed thanks to Max Knuckle, and has the bonus of breaking Reflect and Light Screen otherwise.

Items

  • Focus Sash lets Excadrill focus on supporting the team to its fullest extent, without worrying about getting OHKOed.

  • Assault Vest is the item of choice if Excadrill plans on Dynamaxing, making it a surprisingly bulky Pokemon. It also lets Excadrill handle Nihilego far better than it would otherwise.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: This maximizes Excadrill's Speed and power, letting it outspeed Pokemon in a similar speed bracket such as Dragonite and Gyarados.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Adamant: While this spread no longer allows Excadrill to outspeed Dragonite and Gyarados consistently, it does allow Excadrill to KO Dynamax Nihilego with Rock Tomb + Earthquake under Grassy Terrain.

  • 244 HP / 116 Atk / 148 Spe with Adamant: This spread is a good fit for bulkier Assault Vest sets, allowing Excadrill to OHKO Dynamax Naganadel with Max Quake, while still outspeeding them after one use of Rock Tomb.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Excadrill's decent Speed tier and access to Mold Breaker make it a good choice for Choice Scarf revenge killing, outspeeding major threats such as Mimikyu, Pheromosa, and Dragapult.

  • Horn Drill is Excadrill's best hope at breaking past defensive Pokemon such as Cresselia and Tapu Fini, with a 30% chance of OHKOing them as long as they aren't Dynamaxed.

  • Rock Slide is Excadrill's most powerful option for coverage against Flying-types. Rock Tomb is a weaker alternative that does provide Speed control in a pinch.

Sand Sweeper.description:
• When it comes to Sand Stream sweeping, no Pokemon does the job better than Excadrill, who fully takes advantage of Dynamax to both set up the sand, and Max Moves to increase its bulk.

  • Rock Slide's chance to flinch makes it a good choice for a Rock-type attack outside of Dynamax, but Rock Blast deserves special mention for blasting through Disguise and Focus Sash.

  • Swords Dance makes Excadrill less reliant on Dynamax to sweep, and lets Excadrill deal massive damage to defensive Pokemon such as Tapu Fini and Cresselia.

  • Brick Break allows Excadrill to boost its Attack while Dynamaxed via Max Knuckle, in addition to breaking Reflect and Light Screen outside of it.

  • While Excadrill is fully capable of setting up sand on its own thanks to Dynamax, consider pairing Excadrill with Hippowdon or Tyranitar to ease reliance on Max Rockfall in certain match-ups.

Items

  • Weakness Policy takes full advantage of Excadrill's Dynamax capabilities, especially since its two Max Move STABs boost its defensive stats.

  • Focus Sash gels well with setting up Swords Dance at unexpected times, opening up new late-game sweeping opportunities.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: This EV spread makes Excadrill as fast as possible, outspeeding key threats under Sandstorm such as Dragapult and Choice Scarf Cinderace.

  • 196 Atk / 140 SpD / 172 Spe with Jolly: This EV spread gives Excadrill enough Special Defense to survive Choice Specs Rotom-W's Hydro Pump while Dynamaxed, while still outspeeding up to Choice Scarf Naganadel under Sandstorm.

Physical Sweeper.description:
• Sporting a solid typing, colorful coverage, and access to Swift Swim, Seismitoad is a potent rain sweeper that can threaten many common Pokemon in the Series 12 format.

  • Seismitoad's spammable STAB combination allows it to set its own rain with Max Geyser and boost its Special Defense with Max Quake while Dynamaxed, making it more difficult to revenge kill.

  • Power Whip is necessary coverage to break past Water-immune Pokemon and other bulky Water-types, such as Kyogre, Quagsire, and Tapu Fini, with Life Orb-boosted Max Overgrowth OHKOing all three.

  • Brick Break is Seismitoad's best option for a physical Max Knuckle, further preventing Ferrothorn and physically defensive Porygon2 from walling it. Brick Break also allows Seismitoad to remove opposing Light Screen and Reflect for its team.

  • Bounce is Seismitoad's only option for Max Airstream, but the Speed boost can be crucial if rain runs out the following turn, and it heavily damages most Grass-type switch-ins. Notably, it is the only listed move that can damage Shedinja while Seismitoad is Dynamaxed.

  • Ice Punch is Seismitoad's only way to hit Dragonite and defensive Zygarde-C for meaningful damage, maintains coverage against Grass-types, and is its strongest option against Landorus-T outside of rain.

  • At the cost of a coverage option, Seismitoad can set Stealth Rock if its team lacks a setter. Due to its ability to threaten a sweep under rain, Seismitoad can find opportunities to set up Stealth Rock on predicted switches to checks like Ferrothorn, Lapras, and Shedinja.

  • Toxic may seem strange on such an offensive Pokemon, but it supports Seismitoad's team by crippling a potentially troublesome wall, and Seismitoad's threat level tends to draw walls in. Additionally, if Seismitoad forgoes Bounce, Toxic is its only option to defeat Heavy-Duty Boots Shedinja.

  • Kyogre is one of Seismitoad's best teammates, as it can summon rain with Drizzle to kickstart a Seismitoad sweep, and together they can wear down their shared checks.

  • While Seimitoad's power under rain and many coverage options make it difficult to keep in check, it still needs to be wary of Grass- and bulky Water-types. Zapdos makes for a standout partner, threatening them with its accurate STAB Hurricane and Thunder under rain. Urshifu-S pressures the likes of Ferrothorn, Shedinja, and Porygon2, which give Seismitoad trouble.

Items

  • Life Orb is the best item to enable a Seismitoad sweep, granting it high damage output while Dynamaxed despite an only average Attack stat.

  • Choice Band makes Seismitoad worse at Dynamax sweeping, in exchange for OHKOing maximum HP Zacian-C and havng a 70% chance of OHKOing maximum HP Kyogre with Power Whip.

  • However, if Life Orb is already being used by another Pokemon, other viable options include Mystic Water, Rindo Berry, and Expert Belt. Do note that Seismitoad needs either a Life Orb or Expert Belt to OHKO Kyogre with Max Overgrowth.

EV Spreads

  • 252 Atk / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Adamant: Under rain, this EV spread lets Seismitoad outspeed the entire unboosted metagame bar Regieleki, as well as +1 positive-natured base 100s.

  • 116 HP / 252 Atk / 140 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread gives Seismitoad a good chance of surviving a Play Rough from Jolly Zacian-C while still outspeeding Pheromosa and Calyrex-S under rain.

  • 52 HP / 252 Atk / 204 Spe with Adamant: If Seismitoad is holding a Rindo Berry, this EV spread will allow it to survive a Grassy Glide from Choice Band Rillaboom under Dynamax.

Specially Defensive Support.description:
• With its serviceable bulk, great defensive typing, and coveted Water Absorb ability, Seismitoad can act as one of the sturdiest Kyogre switch-ins around while blanket checking the metagame's many Water-types. While it competes with Gastrodon, which sports higher special bulk and access to Recover, Seismitoad's unique utility movepool and access to Grass-type coverage make it less predictable.

  • Stealth Rock is the primary advantage Seismitoad has over many other Water-immune Pokemon, freeing up its teammates to run more offensive sets.

  • Seismitoad's access to Toxic, very valuable and rare for a non-Poison type, is key to put foes on a timer.

  • If holding a Light Ball, Fling becomes a one-time paralysis-inducing move, which can be a nasty surprise for offensive switch-ins that don't mind Toxic but hate the Speed drop from paralysis.

  • If holding Leftovers, Protect allows Seismitoad to restore a bit of additional HP per turn, as well as scouting for potentially devastating Grass-type coverage.

  • Power Whip is an option for more security against bulkier Kyogre variants, particularly those with Substitute + Calm Mind. In general, carrying Grass-type coverage makes Seismitoad a much better check to many threatening Water-types, such as Tapu Fini, Quagsire, and Rotom-W.

  • Rest when paired with Chesto Berry, lets Seismitoad stick around much longer.

Items

  • Light Ball makes Fling a one-time paralysis-inducing move.

  • Leftovers provides Seismitoad with passive recovery each turn, and it synergizes especially well with Protect. Aguav Berry is an alternate healing option.

  • Chesto Berry is required when running Rest, to avoid losing serious momentum while asleep.

EV Spreads

  • The listed 4 Speed EVs allow Fling Seismitoad to outpace paralyzed Cinderace.

  • 212 HP / 4 Atk / 92 Def / 196 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: This EV spread allows Seismitoad to avoid the 2HKO from Adamant Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade, avoid the OHKO from its Play Rough, and survive a Choice Band-boosted Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: This spread maximizes Seismitoad's special bulk, letting it take on Kyogre as well as possible.

  • 228 HP / 4 Atk / 76 Def / 196 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: This spread allows Seismitoad to always survive Timid Life Orb Yveltal's Max Darkness and almost always survive Adamant Zacian-C's Play Rough.

Specially-based Sweeper.description:
• Despite its lower Special Attack stat, Seismitoad can run a specially-based set worth consideration, as Hydro Pump actually outdamages Liquidation against neutral targets, and the ability to catch opponents off guard with a mixed set has tremendous value in a best-of-one format.

  • A Ground-type STAB move lets Seismitoad deal good damage against Zacian-C, with Earthquake doing more against Kyogre and Tyranitar, while Earth Power is less vulnerable to Attack drops via Intimidate or burn.

  • Power Whip nets crucial coverage against Water-immune Pokemon and bulky Water-types. Grass Knot is a feasible alternative, sporting much higher damage against physically-bulky targets like Quagsire. It is significantly weaker against Kyogre and Gastrodon than Power Whip, though, and will fail if the target is Dynamaxed.

  • Focus Blast is Seismitoad's only way of hitting Ferrothorn for significant damage, netting a 2HKO against specially defensive variants outside of Dynamax.

  • Sludge Bomb allows Seismitoad to boost its Special Attack with Max Ooze while Dynamaxed, and it's Seismitoad's strongest option against Rillaboom.

  • Seismitoad can set Stealth Rock if there's not already a setter on its team, but it won't be able to surmount Grass-types.

  • While Toxic may seem out of place on a set designed for sweeping, it is Seismitoad's only shot at beating Chansey, specially defensive Porygon2, and Shedinja, and it can put other troublesome walls on a timer for its team.

Items

  • Life Orb is the best item to enable a Seismitoad sweep, granting it high damage output while Dynamaxed despite its only average attacking stats.

  • However, if Life Orb is already being used by another Pokemon on the team, other viable options include Mystic Water, Assault Vest, and Expert Belt.

EV Spreads

  • 4 Atk / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Mild: Under rain, Seismitoad will outspeed the entire unboosted metagame bar Regieleki, as well as +1 positive-natured base 100s. A Mild nature is preferred over Rash to always survive a Max Geyser from Modest Kyogre while Dynamaxed.

  • A special-only set with a Modest nature can be run if opting for Grass Knot, though such a set struggles even more to break past many of the metagame's special walls.

Whimsicott.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Prankster Support.description:
• This Whimsicott functions to help hyper offensive or setup sweeper-centered builds set up against faster foes.

  • Tailwind is used to boost Speed while sacrificing Whimsicott, allowing the incoming Pokemon to take advantage of the Speed boost.

  • Alternatively, Switcheroo in combination with Lagging Tail makes the foe setup fodder for certain sweepers that can take advantage of slowed Pokemon to rack up boosts.

  • Memento allows Whimsicott to freely pivot against opposing Pokemon after setting up speed control. Memento finds usefulness in guaranteeing one turn of Dynamax stalling, avoiding opposing boosts from secondary effects of Max Moves or Moxie, and also neutering Dynamax sweepers via attacking stat drops.

  • Moonblast is Whimsicott's primary STAB move, hitting Dark types, which are not affected by Prankster, hard. Energy Ball also makes a decent STAB, letting Whimsicott deal serious damage to Tapu Fini and Rotom-W.

  • Taunt prevents Whimsicott from being Taunted itself as well as shuts down more passive Pokemon such as Swampert and Hippowdon. Charm stifles physical Pokemon without needing to sacrifice Whimsicott via Memento.

Items

  • Focus Sash lets Whimsicott survive even powerful attacks, ensuring it can support your offensive Pokemon.

  • Lagging Tail should only be used with Switcheroo.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Modest or Timid: This is used with attacking sets and Focus Sash to give Whimsicott the ability to hit hard when using Moonblast or Energy Ball. Timid is an alternate option for outspeeding Garchomp.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with a Bold nature: This maximizes physical bulk in order to get off a Switcheroo or Fling followed by Memento without getting OHKOed and should be used for all non-attacking variants.

Cotton Guard Stall.description:
• This Whimsicott takes advantage of Prankster to set up Cotton Guard, allowing it to stop even would-be physical checks, such as Metagross, that may try to switch in.

  • Prankster Substitute + Leech Seed serves as its main method of defeating opposing Pokemon, stalling them out while passively sapping HP through Leech Seed and healing through Leftovers.

  • While it might be possible to run a no-attack variant of this version of Whimsicott, Moonblast is strongly recommended in order to hit Dark-types, which are unaffected by Prankster, and to ensure that Whimsicott is not complete Taunt bait.

  • The given EV spread maximizes physical bulk in order to Leech Seed stall most effectively and take minimal damage from physical threats immediately after a Cotton Guard boost.

Darmanitan-Galar.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Gorilla Tactics.description:
• Galarian Darmanitan has the highest Attack stat in the format after accounting for Gorilla Tactics, allowing it to hit incredibly hard with relatively high speed without taking an additional penalty from a Choice item.

  • Earthquake is highly recommended, as it's Galarian Darmanitan's best attack against Tapu Fini.

  • U-turn allows Galarian Darmanitan to do substantial chip damage while not locking itself into an attack. Superpower is Galarian Darmanitan's best attack against Rotom-W.

Items

  • Choice Scarf makes Galarian Darmanitan into a good revenge killer, outspeeding prominent foes such as Dragapult and Landorus-T with a Jolly nature.

  • Choice Band makes Galarian Darmanitan more effecitve as a wall breaker, making Earthquake deal over 50% to Bold Tapu Fini.

GORILLA WARFARE.description:
• With its sky high Attack stat and the in-built Choice Band of Gorilla Tactics, Galarian Darmanitan boasts the highest natural raw Attack in the game.

  • Flare Blitz provides valuable coverage against Steel-Types like Zacian-C, Necrozma-DM and Ferrothorn.

  • Earthquake hits Rock-Types for heavy damage and provides a way to threaten foes like Zacian-C without the recoil of Flare Blitz.

  • U-turn makes Galarian Darmanitan a great pivot, doing heavy damage to most targets while maintaining a switch advantage.

  • Stone Edge and Rock Slide can be used to heavily pressure Ho-Oh.

  • Superpower is great for breaking through Tyranitar, Chansey, and Blissey with minimal stress. Should you choose to Dynamax Galarian Darmanitan, you can use Max Knuckle to take its Attack to unmatched levels.

  • It is worth noting that when Dynamaxed, Galarian Darmanitan will lose its Gorilla Tactics boost, so Dynamax should only be used when it is necessary to switch moves

Items

  • Choice Scarf helps patch up Galarian Darmanitan’s somewhat disappointing Speed stat, allowing it to threaten the likes of Eternatus more easily.

  • Focus Sash can let Galarian Darmanitan get around its abysmal bulk, ensuring it gets an attack off as a lead and potentially letting you preserve it for later in the game. If hazards are not in play, Focus Sash Galarian Darmanitan can also be used to threaten big damage on Max Airstream users, such as Yveltal.

  • Choice Band takes Galarian Darmanitan’s offense to new heights, letting it perform absurd feats such as OHKOing fully defensive Toxapex with Earthquake, alongside making its Icicle Crash all but impossible to safely switch into.

Zen Mode.description:
• By using Zen Mode, Galarian Darmanitan gains the ability to switch moves, potentially securing a surprise KO. Zen Mode also increases Darmanitan-G’s Attack and Speed even further once activated. The Speed boost makes it quite fast, and it can surprise previously-faster targets with a devastating second attack.

  • Flare Blitz is valuable coverage against Steel-types such as Zacian-C and Necrozma-DM, additionally, the recoil from Flare Blitz can potentially activate Zen Mode, boosting its offenses and giving it STAB on Flare Blitz.

  • Earthquake hits Rock-types such as Tyranitar for heavy damage while also threatening the odd Heatran.

  • With Yawn, Galarian Darmanitan can support its team in the event it is walled while still being a potent offensive threat. Yawn is also somewhat unexpected on Galarian Darmanitan, since opponents must respect the more common Gorilla Tactics set.

  • Stone Edge can be used to heavily pressure Ho-Oh.

  • Superpower provides super effective coverage against Chansey, Blissey, and Tyranitar, as well as giving Galarian Darmanitan access to Max Knuckle.

Gothitelle.overview: If you have any questions about the set, feel free to ask any in the Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Discussion thread.

Ferrothorn.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A- Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are fantastic in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame, and can sweep, support, or wall significant portions of the metagame. These Pokemon require less support than most others to be used effectively and have few flaws that can easily be overlooked when compared to their positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Defensive.description:
• Despite Fire- and Fighting-type coverage at every corner, Ferrothorn somehow manages to be a major defensive threat. Its ability to take over the game once its counters have been removed is unparalleled, so take advantage of its strong pressure at team preview.

  • The Leech Seed and Protect combo can recover a lot of HP, while Gyro Ball does a lot of immediate damage.

  • Grass-type STAB is strongly recommended to not lose to Calm Mind + Substitute Raikou. Power Whip is the obvious answer, but Bullet Seed does work better against Mimikyu's Disguise and Swampert that carry Focus Sash or Rindo Berry.

  • Ferrothorn is a very reliable user of Stealth Rock, so it can be worth giving up Protect if hazards are needed.

  • Knock Off does decent damage to Fire-type switch-ins, and removing valuable items such as Porygon2's Eviolite gives it utility.

  • Body Press takes advantage of Ferrothorn's impressive Defense stat, and gives it an advantage against opposing Ferrothorn.

  • Use Ferrothorn's immense defenses and numerous resistances to pivot into Pokemon like Tapu Fini, then use Leech Seed or its strong attacks to pressure Cinderace, Urshifu, and other Pokemon that switch into Ferrothorn, then switch out to an appropriate answer.

Items

  • Leftovers is the best recovery option for Ferrothorn, since it tends to stick around for a while.

  • Occa Berry can save Ferrothorn once against weaker Fire-type attacks from foes like Dragapult.

  • Rocky Helmet seriously punishes Pokemon that use contact moves, such as Urshifu-R and Garchomp.

Set-Up.description:
• Iron Defense + Body Press lets Ferrothorn do a lot of damage for a defensive tank, and lets Ferrothorn win matchups against other defensive Pokemon such as opposing Ferrothorn that might otherwise result in a deadlock.

  • Leech Seed can recover HP lost trying to set up, and can let Ferrothorn completely stonewall physical attackers. It is also the best move to cover a switch-in when Ferrothorn cannot sweep yet.

Items

  • Leftovers gels well with this Ferrothorn's nature as a defensive set-up Pokemon.

  • Occa Berry, when combined with Iron Defense, lets Ferrothorn survive surprising Fire-type attacks, such as Life Orb Cinderace's G-Max Fireball.

Other Options

These sets are more niche than the others, but can still be considered if they fulfill a specfic purpose on your team.

Choice Band.description:
• Thanks to Ferrothorn's high BP STABs, it can make an unexpected bulky offensive threat with Choice Band.

  • Bullet Seed can be used instead of Power Whip to get around Focus Sash, Rindo Berry, and Mimikyu's Disguise more easily.

  • Knock Off and Bulldoze let Ferrothorn catch bulky Steel-types such as Celesteela and Heatran off guard with more offensive power and coverage than usual.

Thundurus.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B+ Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Dynamax Sweeper.description:
• With Defiant punishing Intimidate and a good Speed tier, Thundurus carves out a niche as a viable alternative to Zapdos as a Max Airstream user.

  • Fly is Thundurus's main mode of using Max Airstream. Additionally, it can help stall out Dynamax turns.

  • Bulk Up is Thundurus's only means of boosting its Attack outside of Dynamax, and makes it harder to revenge kill with physical attackers.

  • Taunt is great for punishing more passive Pokemon such as Celesteela and Ferrothorn. Superpower gives Thundurus another means to boost its Attack while Dynamaxed, while Iron Tail becomes a way to boost Thundurus's Defense while Dynamaxed.

Items

  • Life Orb gives Thundurus the most consistent damage output, and makes it less reliant on setting up Bulk Up to sweep.

  • Sharp Beak is a viable alternative if another Pokemon is using Life Orb.

  • Lum Berry protects Thundurus from potential status.

Prankster Support.description:
• With access to Prankster, Thundurus can be a disruptive threat to sweepers. Substitute in particular allows Thundurus to potentially stall out Dynamax Pokemon.

  • Thunder Wave is also key to crippling Dynamax sweepers, as it punishes Pokemon that use Max Airstream. Note however, that several prominent Max Airstream sweepers such as Landorus-T, Zapdos, and Galarian Moltres are immune to Prankster Thunder Wave.

  • Grass Knot is Thundurus's only way of hitting Ground-type Pokemon.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry can get activated by Thundurus using Substitute, making it an ideal way to get quick recovery.

  • Leftovers is also a viable alternative if Sitrus Berry is used by a different Pokemon.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 76 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 172 Spe with Timid: This spread allows Thundurus to outpace up to base 100 Speed Pokemon such as Salamence and Zapdos, with the rest going into bulk that ensures Porygon2 will not get a Special Attack boost from Download.

  • 4 Def / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: This EV spread allows Thundurus to operate in a more offensive manner.

Reshiram.overview: These sets are for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Dragon Dance.description:
EV Spreads

  • 252 Atk / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: Reshiram is in a hotly contested Speed tier, making maximizing Speed the safest choice.

  • 60 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 188 Spe with Adamant: This spread survives Adamant Zacian-C's Play Rough, allowing Reshiram to sacrifice itself with Flare Blitz if needed. It also outspeeds Eternatus after using Dragon Dance.

Zekrom.overview: This set is for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Dynamax Sweeper.description:
Items

  • Life Orb: This item makes Zekrom an immediate threat, even without set-up.

  • Weakness Policy Weakness Policy potentially lets Dynamax Zekrom sweep without needing to set up Dragon Dance, and works especially well on dual screen teams.

  • Assault Vest: Assault Vest improves Zekrom's match up against Yveltal and Kyogre, at the cost of needing to use Max Knuckle from Body Press to boost Attack.

  • Lum Berry: This is Zekrom's best option for dealing with Will-O-Wisp from the likes of Mimikyu and Victini, while powering through Yawn if Electric Terrain is not up.

Landorus-Therian.overview:
Viability Ranking: S Rank

Reserved for the best Pokemon in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon are usually able to perform a variety of roles effectively, or can just do one extremely well. Their use has low risk involved and high reward exerted. Pokemon in this rank have very few flaws that are patched up by numerous positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Dynamax Sweeper.description:
• Landorus-T is one of the most fearsome Dynamax sweepers in the Crown Tundra metagame due to its impressive bulk and STAB Max Airstream.

  • Stone Edge is a required coverage option in order to hit Celesteela, as it otherwise walls its STAB options.

  • Swords Dance allows Landorus to set up on predicted switches it forces from its Intimidate drops, while also supplying a Max Guard option while in Dynamax form.

  • Superpower is a good alternative for raising Landorus-T's attack while Dynamaxed.

  • An Adamant nature with the given EV spread allows Landorus-T to outspeed up to Choice Scarf Dracovish after a Speed boost. A Jolly nature allows it to outspeed positive nature Pheromosa at +1.

Items

  • Life Orb makes Landorus-T a fearsome sweeper even before boosting its Attack stat.

  • Lum Berry protects Landorus-T from status, allowing it to take advantage of Yawn in particular.

Bulky Support.description:
• Landorus-T can use its great bulk to serve as both a Stealth Rock setter and a slow pivot against the plethora of physical attackers.

  • This Landorus-T prefers at least a Speed IV of 30. This way, it has a slower U-turn against more offensive Landorus-T, who can easily take advantage of your Landorus-T by setting up, or dealing massive damage to switch-ins.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry is Landorus-T's most reliable form of recovery, though it is a high value item.

  • Iapapa Berry and other similar items are an alternative to Sitrus Berry, giving it more recovery at the cost of activating when Landorus-T is at lower health.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Landorus-T when equipped with a Choice Scarf is one of the best pivots in the meta, providing fast U-turn + Intimidate support while threatening the likes of Cinderace, which it can now easily outspeed.

  • Rock Tomb allows Landorus-T to provide suicide Speed control against Dynamax sweepers, while Stone Edge or Rock Slide provide more damage and a stronger Max Move.

  • Fly is included to threaten Grass-types like Rillaboom if you choose to Dynamax, and can also be used outside of Dynamax to stall out opposing Dynamax turns.

Suicide Lead.description:
• This is a more niche use of Landorus-T, since many teams can't afford to use it as a suicide lead. It's fully capable of this role, however.

  • This Landorus-T is more easily able to set up Stealth Rock against offensive threats, at the cost of a valuable Focus Sash slot. Note that this Landorus-T still loses to Urshifu-R and Glastrier that have Icicle Spear.

  • U-turn is best for scouting potential, but Self-Destruct does let Landorus-T get a massive hit in before fainting, potentially getting in a deadly sweeper.

Kyurem-White.overview: These sets are for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Dynamax.description:
Items

  • Assault Vest: This makes Kyurem-W a decent check to Kyogre.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb's immense power allows Kyurem-W to 2HKO Dynamax Dialga that lack Assault Vest with Max Quake.

Xerneas.overview: These sets are for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Bulky Geomancy.description:
EV Spreads

  • 156 HP / 252 Def / 44 SpA / 4 SpD / 52 Spe with Bold: This EV spread lets Dynamax Xerneas use Max Steelspike to survive Adamant Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade followed by Quick Attack. The Speed investment ensures Xerneas will outspeed Choice Scarf Victini after Geomancy.

Yveltal.overview: These sets are for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Special Attacker.description:
Items

  • Life Orb: Life Orb makes Yveltal an extremely danagerous Dynamax sweeper with no prior set-up.

  • Assault Vest: This makes Yveltal a very bulky Dynamax sweeper, at the cost of being unable to use Taunt.

  • Weakness Policy: If the Life Orb slot is used up or dual screens are used, Weakness Policy can seriously punish foes using super-effective attacks.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: This spread maximizes Yveltal's Special Attack and Speed, outpacing key threats such as Mimikyu and Kyurem-W.

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Modest: This spread sacrifices outspeeding Mimikyu and Kyurem-W for potentially breaking past the many Pokemon that invest in surviving Timid Yveltal. This spread still outspeeds Calyrex-S after using Max Airstream.

  • 140 HP / 172 SpA / 196 Spe with Timid: This EV spread minimizes Life Orb recoil, survives Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade, avoids a 2HKO from Calyrex-S's Max Starfall while under Dynamax, and outspeeds Timid Kyogre.

Stall Breaker.description:
Items

  • Leftovers: The passive recovery gels well with Yveltal's ability to shut down defensive Pokemon.

  • Kee Berry The Defense boost can let Yveltal survive Zacian-C's Play Rough.

  • Lum Berry / Cheri Berri: These two berries can be used to effectively shut down Fling + Light Ball users such as Groudon.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 60 Def / 196 Spe with Timid: This spread allows Yveltal to outspeed Jolly Landorus-T.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Bold: This spread fully maximizes Yveltal's Defense.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Timid: This spread maximizes Yveltal's Speed, allowing it to outspeed and use Taunt on Mimikyu before it can use a status move.

Physical Attacker.description:
Items

  • Life Orb: This is the best item choice, giving Adamant Yveltal a chance to KO Zacian-C switching in with Max Airstream into Max Flare.

  • Weakness Policy: Weakness Policy can turn Yveltal into a dangerous Dynamax sweeper.

  • Black Glasses: If Life Orb is used up, Black Glasses is a good alternative for boosting Dark-type attacks.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Adamant: This spread maximizes Yveltal's Attack, while letting it outspeed Calyrex-S after a Max Airstream.

  • 140 HP / 172 Atk / 196 Spe with Jolly: This spread outspeeds Jolly Landorus-T, minimizes Life Orb recoil, and avoids an OHKO from Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade.

Zygarde.overview: These sets are for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Specially Defensive Coil.description:
EV Spreads

  • 236 HP / 116 SpD / 156 Spe with Careful: This spread survives Life Orb Modest Yveltal's Max Darkness while in the 50% forme, and outspeeds +1 Timid Yveltal as Zygarde-C after paralyzing it with Glare.

  • 252 HP / 204 SpD / 52 Spe with Careful: This bulkier spread allows Zygarde-C to outspeed a paralyzed Calyrex-S.

Physically Defensive Coil.description:
EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 124 Def / 132 Spe with Impish: The given Speed EVs lets Zygarde outspeed Choice Scarf Mimikyu after Glare.

  • 252 HP / 204 Def / 52 Spe with Impish: With these Speed EVs, Zygarde outspeeds up to paralyzed Calyrex-S.

Incineroar.overview: If you have any questions about the sets, feel free to ask any in the Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Discussion thread.

Assault Vest.description:
EV Spreads

  • 244 HP / 4 Atk / 4 Def / 236 SpD / 20 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread allows Incineroar to almost always survive a +2 Max Quake from Calyrex-S, while outspeeding most Tyranitar.

  • 252 HP / 116 Def / 140 SpD with Sassy: This spread avoids a 2HKO from Timid Life Orb Yveltal's Max Airstream, while having the slowest possible U-turn.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpD with Sassy: This spread lets Incineroar survive two Max Airstreams from Modest Life Orb Yveltal, at the cost of physical bulk.

Support.description:
EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpD with Sassy: This spread allows Incineroar to handle Calyrex-S and Yveltal more effectively, while having the slowest use of Parting Shot possible.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with Relaxed: Maximizing Defense makes Incineroar more capable of crippling Zacian-C and Necrozma-DM.

Primarina.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B- Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Offensive.description:
• Primarina is usually severely overshadowed by Tapu Fini, but Primarina does offer some small advantages, such as a much higher Special Attack stat, Grass-type coverage, and being able to pick off Focus Sash Pokemon with Aqua Jet.

Items

  • Assault Vest is the most common item on offensive Primarina to take advantage of its good special bulk.

  • Choice Specs is still viable for offering a lot of firepower, especially compared to Tapu Fini.

  • Focus Sash lets Primarina take advantage of Torrent more easily, and lets it deal massive damage to Pokemon it'd normally be KOed by.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 28 Def / 228 SpA: This spread maximizes special attack and bulk, and always takes a Choice Band Urshifu Thunder Punch.

  • 4 Atk / 252 SpA / 252 Spe: This spread is viable with more offensive items, especially Focus Sash.

  • 252 HP / 156 Def / 100 SpA: This spread gives Primarina the ability to always survive Max Lightning from Urshifu formes.

Lycanroc-Dusk.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B- Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Focus Sash.description:
• Lycanroc-D is a decent and unique Focus Sash lead due to its access to all of Counter, Endeavor, Stealth Rock, and a unique STAB priority move.

  • Counter, when combined with Accelerock, allows Lycanroc-D to defeat promiment physical Dynamax sweepers such as Cinderace. This set almost requires Focus Sash to remain intact, so be wary of Lycanroc-D taking residual damage if the opponent still has physical sweepers in play.

  • Close Combat allows Lycanroc-D to hit Ferrothorn and many other Steel-types harder than its STAB coverage, and gets a Tough Claws boost, unlike many of its higher-Base Power STAB moves.

  • Stealth Rock allows Lycanroc-D to support sweepers on its team, helping break opposing Focus Sash and weakening opposing Galarian Moltres and Glastrier.

  • Endeavor allows Lycanroc-D to also defeat many special attackers one-on-one, but be wary of Dynamaxed foes, which will only go to half health if Lycanroc is put to 1 HP.

  • Swords Dance allows Lycanroc-D to become less passive and punishes opponents that try to play around its somewhat predictable Focus Sash strategies.

  • Rock Tomb can be used to provide speed control for incoming sweepers, allowing the likes of Cinderace and Urshifu-R to outspeed many threats to their sweep.

Toxapex.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B+ Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Physical Wall.description:
• Toxapex's extremely passive playstyle and unfortunate weakness to Ground-type attacks may not make it the first choice for a bulky Water-type, but its excellent support movepool and incredible defensive capabilities make a staple on stall teams.

  • Scald is Toxapex's ideal way to spread burns, and ensure that Ground-types don't switch into it for free.

  • Haze is very effective at stopping set-up opportunities.

  • Toxic lets Toxapex cripple a wide variety of defensive and support Pokemon, such as Porygon2, Cresselia, and Hippowdon.

  • Baneful Bunker is a good way to help stall out Dynamax turns, with a bonus of poisoning foes that use contact moves.

  • Poison Jab may be weak, but with a Relaxed nature, it deals good chip damage to incoming Tapu Fini, Tapu Koko, and Rillaboom. Tapu Fini in particular is an important target due to its habit of running Taunt.

Mimikyu.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: S Rank

Reserved for the best Pokemon in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon are usually able to perform a variety of roles effectively, or can just do one extremely well. Their use has low risk involved and high reward exerted. Pokemon in this rank have very few flaws that are patched up by numerous positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Swords Dance Sweeper.description:
• With Swords Dance, Disguise, and access to priority attacking in Shadow Sneak, Mimikyu is a potent revenge killer and sweeper in one package.

  • Phantom Force is useful for stalling out Dynamax turns and becoming an extra powerful Max Phantasm. However, Phantom Force's extra turn to charge up can be an issue versus Normal-type switch-ins such as Porygon2 and Snorlax.

  • Alternatively, Shadow Claw is useful for picking off the same weakened foes that Phantom Force does, without risking the opponent being able to take advantage of the extra turn with Phantom Force.

  • Mimikyu makes a fantastic user of Dynamax, especially with Max Starfall protecting it from status and Max Phantasm lowering the foe's Defense stat.

Items

  • Life Orb is the best choice for ensuring Mimikyu can effectively revenge kill and sweep through teams.

  • Spell Tag makes a decent alternative if another Pokemon needs Life Orb.

Kee Berry Sweeper.description:
• Mimikyu equipped with a Kee Berry and Drain Punch can beat out many slower foes that traditionally give it trouble, such as Ferrothorn and Snorlax.

  • Play Rough is the primary STAB move of choice and grants Mimikyu immunity to status with Misty Terrain from Max Starfall. Phantom Force can be useful instead to stall opposing Dynamax turns.

  • Shadow Sneak is obligatory so Mimikyu can most effectively take advantage of its Disguise and Swords Dance.

  • Drain Punch gives Mimikyu great longevity against physical attackers and helps it defeat opposing Snorlax and Ferrothorn. Drain Punch additionally becomes Max Knuckle when Dynamaxed, providing greater damage output and boosting Attack by one stage.

  • The given EV spread maximizes Attack, gives Mimikyu the highest odds of surviving foe Jolly Life Orb Mimikyu's Phantom Force after Disguise is broken, and also survives a hit from Jolly Life Orb Dynamaxed Landorus-T after Disguise is broken.

Trick Room Setter.description:
• Curse's sacrificial powers, combined with Disguise, makes it a great setter of Trick Room in the metagame.

  • While the higher damage output of Shadow Claw may be tempting, Shadow Sneak is the better choice for picking off weakened threats.

  • This Mimikyu set excels at checking and sapping momentum from Pokemon that boost their Speed, such as Zapdos and Galarian Moltres.

Items

  • Mental Herb ensures that Mimikyu sets up Trick Room, even if Taunt hits it.

  • Lum Berry lets Mimikyu sacrifice itself without fear of being put to sleep by Yawn.

  • Babiri Berry lets Mimikyu survive Mold Breaker Excadrill's Iron Head.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD Impish: This spread ensures that Mimikyu will survive one Life Orb Gmax Fireball from Cinderace, assuming Stealth Rock isn't set up.

  • 212 HP / 188 Atk / 108 Def Adamant: This spread with Babiri Berry survives Adamant Excadrill's Max Steelspike assuming no Stealth Rock damage, while giving Mimikyu a good amount of power.

Disruptor.description:
Items

  • Bright Powder: While unreliable, just one miss can be devestating against this Mimikyu.damage makes it even easier for Dynamax sweepers to set up.

  • Mental Herb: If using Trick Room, Mental Herb is very helpful for getting around Taunt.

  • Rocky Helmet: This gives a bit of extra damage against Pokemon with contact moves such as Zacian-C, which could lead to a Dynamax sweep from teammates such as Yveltal.

Curse Stall.description:
Items

  • Custap Berry: Substitute can help activate Custap Berry, and let Mimikyu deliver an extra move, like Pain Split or Thunder Wave, before fainting.

  • Bright Powder: Brought Powder isn't very reliable, but dodging one attack can make Mimikyu very difficult to deal with.

  • Mental Herb: This will make Mimikyu immune to one use of Taunt, potentially foiling anti-leads such as Yveltal.

Tapu Koko.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B+ Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Special Attacker.description:
• Tapu Koko has a lot of competition from other Electric-types, but its Speed and Electric Surge give it a place in the metagame.

  • Grass Knot is Tapu Koko's best shot at dealing damage to Hippowdon and Swampert, who otherwise wall it.

  • Volt Switch is Tapu Koko's hardest hitting pivoting attack, but U-turn can be considered for letting Tapu Koko scout Ground-type switch-ins. When not using Choice Specs, Taunt is also a good option for stopping foes such as Cresselia and Raikou from setting up.

Items

  • Choice Specs gives Tapu Koko as much power as possible, and pairs especially well with Volt Switch to make Tapu Koko a good pivot.

  • Life Orb should still be considered for making Tapu Koko a better Dynamax user.

Dual Screens.description:
• This set competes heavily with Regieleki's superior speed and Explosion in terms of setting up screens, but Tapu Koko's Electric Surge gives it a viable niche, since it stops grounded Pokemon from falling asleep.

  • Thunderbolt provides reliable power, but Volt Switch can make Tapu Koko a viable pivot.

  • Taunt cripples passive Pokemon, a rare feature for Dual Screeners. Alternately, Nature's Madness provides reliable damage early game.

  • The given EVs allow Tapu Koko to avoid a 2HKO from Hippowdon and Swampert's Earthquake after Reflect is set up. A more offensive spread is possible, but it does make Tapu Koko a less safe lead against these two.

Items

  • Light Clay is the obvious choice for setting up screens that last a longer time.

  • Shuca Berry can let Tapu Koko more safely Taunt against Hippowdon and Swampert, letting it set up both Reflect and Light Screen even if they use Earthquake as Tapu Koko Taunts.

Physical Attacker.description:
• Tapu Koko may have a shallow physical movepool, but it has a decently high Attack stat, and access to Brave Bird can make it a surprising Max Airstream user while Dynamaxed.

  • U-turn allows Tapu Koko to scout for Ground-type switch-ins, which is especially important since Landorus-T and Hippowdon do very well against this set.

  • Iron Head gives Tapu Koko Max Steelspike while Dynamaxed, useful for boosting its Defense stat. However, with a Naive nature, Grass Knot can be used to deal plenty of damage to Hippowdon and Swampert.

Tapu Lele.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B+ Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Offensive.description:
• With Psychic being boosted by a terrain, Tapu Lele makes a competent offensive threat that doesn't have to worry about priority attacks.

  • Thunderbolt is important coverage, hitting Celesteela, who otherwise walls Tapu Lele.

  • Psyshock lets Tapu Lele hit Pokemon that have softer physical defense such as Raikou harder.

  • Shadow Ball punishes Metagross and Cresselia switch-ins, and hits a lot of Pokemon neutrally in general.

  • Focus Blast is Tapu Lele's best hope at dealing severe damage to Ferrothorn and Heatran, but isn't a particularly reliable move, and is a notoriously poor move while Dynamaxed.

  • Modest is Tapu Lele's best nature for damage output, but Timid is a reasonable alternative if outspeeding Jolly Landorus-T is a must, and it also lets Choice Scarf Tapu Lele outspeed Jolly Pheromosa.

Items

  • Choice Scarf pairs very well with Psychic Terrain, letting Tapu Lele deal massive damage to fast threats without worrying about potential priority attacks.

  • Choice Specs makes Tapu Lele a better wall breaker, notably being able to 2HKO defensive Tapu Fini with Psyshock under Psychic Terrain.

  • Life Orb not only lets Tapu Lele switch up its attacks, but makes it a better Dynamaxer. Just note that most of it's coverage will remove Psychic Terrain.

Tapu Fini.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: S Rank

Reserved for the best Pokemon in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon are usually able to perform a variety of roles effectively, or can just do one extremely well. Their use has low risk involved and high reward exerted. Pokemon in this rank have very few flaws that are patched up by numerous positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Calm Mind.description:
• With an excellent typing and ability to set up Misty Terrain, Tapu Fini is the premier bulky Water-type of the metagame.

  • Surf is the obvious reliable choice for a Water STAB, but Scald can burn floating Pokemon, and others when Misty Terrain expires.

  • Moonblast is Tapu Fini's most reliable Fairy-type STAB. Draining Kiss isn't nearly as powerful, but it restores enough health that it can give Tapu Fini an extra edge against less defensive threats.

  • Taunt is important for shutting down more defensive threats such as Hippowdon, Leech Seed Celesteela, and opposing Tapu Fini.

  • Substitute on the flip side, does a great job of punishing more offensive Tapu Fini switch-ins.

  • Nature's Madness reliably damages switch-ins, even if it isn't boosted by Calm Mind.

Items

  • Leftovers provides a reliable amount of healing while it sets up Calm Mind.

  • Sitrus Berry and berries such as Iapapa Berry give Tapu Fini a quicker burst of recovery, which can improve its match-up against more offensive threats.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 100 Def / 156 Spe Bold: This EV spread allows Tapu Fini to outspeed up to Timid Celesteela, letting it get an important Taunt in before Celesteela attempts to stall with Leech Seed. If needed, more EVs can be shifted to Defense if Celesteela is handled by the team. The rest goes into Defense to increase Tapu Fini's ability to set up Calm Mind.

  • 252 HP / 100 SpA / 156 Spe Modest: This EV spread makes Tapu Fini a better offensive threat while Dynamaxed, notably OHKOing offensive Dynamaxed Landorus-T with a boosted Max Geyser after Stealth Rock damage.

Choice Attacker.description:
• Tapu Fini may not seem strong, but it makes a shockingly capable offensive threat due to its typing and good coverage.

  • Ice Beam is Tapu Fini's best option against a wide variety of threats, mainly Grass- and Flying-types such as Rillaboom and Thundurus-T. Nature's Madness on the other hand, provides reliable damage output against unfavorable switch-ins for Choice Scarf Tapu Fini.

  • Trick is essential, allowing Tapu Fini to cripple bulky Pokemon such as Porygon2 and Celesteela.

  • Modest is the prefered nature for the most damage output possible, but Timid does gurantee that Tapu Fini can outspeed Dracovish, and Dragapult provided that Tapu Fini is holding a Choice Scarf.

Items

  • Choice Specs give Tapu Fini much more power than usual, making it into an effective bulky special attacker.

  • Choice Scarf is a valuable alternative to outspeed major threats such as Landorus-T and Nihilego, and tends to punish defensive Pokemon more when Tricked onto them.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe Modest or Timid: This EV spread gives Tapu Fini the best combination of power and Speed.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 Spe Modest: This is Tapu Fini's bulkiest offensive spread for Choice Specs.

  • 100 HP / 252 SpA / 156 Spe Modest: This spread ensures that Tapu Fini outspeeds Timid Celesteela, while giving it decent bulk.

Lunala.overview: This set is for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Bulky Calm Mind.description:
EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Bold: This maximizes Lunala's physical bulk for potentially stalling Zacian-C out with paralysis, while outspeeding paralyzed Choice Scarf Kyogre.

  • 252 HP / 52 SpA / 204 Spe with Timid: This spread allows Lunala to outspeed +Speed Nature base 90s such as Kyogre, Groudon, and Zekrom.

Nihilego.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A+ Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are fantastic in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame, and can sweep, support, or wall significant portions of the metagame. These Pokemon require less support than most others to be used effectively and have few flaws that can easily be overlooked when compared to their positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Power Herb Sweeper.description:
• Nihilego has access to Meteor Beam, and in combination with Power Herb, it becomes instantaneously threatening through increasing its Special Attack and striking with a 120 BP STAB in one turn.

  • Grass Knot hits common Stealth Rock leads like Swampert and Hippowdon very hard, Thunderbolt best hits the likes of Celesteela and Gyarados, Psyshock allows it to hit other Nihilego and Chansey, Power Gem is an alternative Rock STAB to use when not Dynamaxed, and Stealth Rock helps chip future switch-ins while giving access to a Max Guard option when Dynamaxed.

  • The given EVs ensure Nihilego gets a Speed boost after a KO, complementing the SpA boost gained from Meteor Beam and making it difficult to be revenge killed by the likes of Choice Scarf Landorus-T.

Pheromosa.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are fantastic in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame, and can sweep, support, or wall significant portions of the metagame. These Pokemon require less support than most others to be used effectively and have few flaws that can easily be overlooked when compared to their positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Offensive Pivot.description:
• Pheromosa's incredible Speed and Attack stats make it a dangerous offensive pivot that can dominate the flow of the game.

  • Triple Axel, while not the most reliable move, is Pheromosa's only physical Ice-type option, and is capable of breaking through the likes of Focus Sash Landorus-T and Garchomp.

  • Poison Jab is Pheromosa's best move against Fairy-types such as Tapu Fini and Tapu Koko. Bounce can stall out Dynamax turns, and become a useful Max Airstream if Pheromosa is forced to Dynamax.

  • An Adamant nature is suggested for boosting Pheromosa's Attack stat with Beast Boost. While a Speed boost after a KO is not as valuable, Jolly Pheromosa is still a reasonable option for outspeeding Dragapult and potentially slower Max Airstream users such as Adamant Landorus-T.

Items

  • Focus Sash is Pheromosa's most reliable option, giving it an extra chance against Pokemon it shouldn't be avoiding a KO from normally.

  • Life Orb enhances Pheromosa's potential to sweep late game.

  • Choice Scarf may seem like an off the wall choice for the speedy Pheromosa, but outspeeding boosted Pokemon such as Cinderace and Naganadel is extremely useful.

Celesteela.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: S Rank

Reserved for the best Pokemon in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon are usually able to perform a variety of roles effectively, or can just do one extremely well. Their use has low risk involved and high reward exerted. Pokemon in this rank have very few flaws that are patched up by numerous positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

SubSeed.description:
• Celesteela, with fantastic mixed bulk and typing, becomes the best SubSeed user in the game, with many common Pokemon having difficulty in breaking its Substitute without using Dynamax.

  • Flamethrower allows Celesteela to hit opposing Celesteela and Ferrothorn, as well as OHKO Kartana, while Protect allows it to easily Leech Seed stall every Pokemon that has difficulty breaking its Substitute.

EV Spreads

  • 188 HP / 4 Def / 4 SpA / 60 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This spread gives Celesteela maximum Speed to outspeed as much as possible while gaining a Special Defense boost after every KO.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 244 Spe with Calm or Bold: This spread gives Celesteela the ability to outspeed base 100 Speed Pokemon after a Max Airstream boost while shoring up either a Special Defense or Defense boost after a KO.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 244 Spe with Careful or Impish: For this spread, Air Slash is replaced with Heavy Slam and Flamethrower is replaced with Earthquake to help Celesteela better defeat Fairy-types and Heatran.

Special Sweeper.description:
• Celesteela's massive bulk is augmented when Dynamaxed, which assists it in becoming a potent sweeper in combination with its STAB Max Airstream and Beast Boost combination.

  • Flash Cannon and Flamethrower are the safer move options when Dynamax ends, but Steel Beam and Fire Blast give more firepower and are the better attacks while Dynamaxed.

Items

  • Weakness Policy is the more common item, as it's easily activated during Dynamax, and gives Celesteela plenty of power to sweep.

  • Meteor Beam with a Power Herb allows Celesteela to instantly boost its Special Attack and punishes common switch-ins such as Zapdos and Cinderace.

EV Spreads

  • 244 SpA / 20 SpD / 244 Spe with Modest: These EVs allow Celesteela to outspeed base 100 Speed Pokemon after a Max Airstream while gaining Special Attack boosts after each KO. The Special Defense investment avoids a Special Attack boost from Porygon2's Download.

  • 148 HP / 20 Def / 252 SpA / 44 SpD / 44 Spe with Modest: This EV spread takes a bulkier approach to sweeping, allowing Dynamax Celesteela to survive Cinderace's Life Orb G-Max Fireball and Zapdos's Life Orb Max Lightning.

Kartana.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B+ Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Physical Sweeper.description:
• Kartana's impressive Attack stat and Beast Boost make it a capable late-game physical sweeper, only held back by its awful Special Defense and low base power attacks.

  • Aerial Ace may seem weak, but it gives Kartana access to Max Airstream while Dynamaxed, giving it a good shot of sweeping late-game. Smart Strike is weak for a STAB Attack, but it OHKOs Nihilego, and grants access to the useful Max Steelspike while Dynamaxed. While difficult to fit in, Giga Impact is Kartana's best hope of doing decent damage to Zapdos with Max Strike.

  • Swords Dance makes Kartana less reliant on Dynamax and Beast Boost to sweep, and pairs especially well with Focus Sash.

Items

  • Focus Sash lets Kartana survive in match-ups that may normally be difficult for it to win, mainly against special attackers.

  • Life Orb makes Kartana a better late-game sweeper when Dynamaxed.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Kartana's access to Beast Boost makes it a reasonable choice for Choice Scarf revenge killing and late-game sweeping.

  • Guillotine is an emergency attack to have a 30% shot at destroying bulky Pokemon, while Aerial Ace gives Kartana a Speed boost if Dynamax sweeping presents itself to Kartana.

Necrozma-Dusk-Mane.overview: These sets are for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

HEAVY METAL (Bulky Dragon Dance).description:
Items

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet lets Necrozma-DM deal damage to Zacian-C as it switches in.

  • Weakness Policy: With Weakness Policy, Necrozma-DM becomes a far more fearsome Dynamax sweeper.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 140 Def / 116 Spe: The given Speed EVs allow Necrozma-DM to outspeed Timid Yveltal after one Dragon Dance, while surviving 2 hits from Zacian-C 73.6% of the time.

Support.description:
EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe This spread avoids a 2HKO from Zacian-C's Close Combat.

  • 252 HP / 140 Def / 116 Spe: This spread sacrifices some bulk to outspeed Calyrex-S after paralysis, while still avoiding a 2HKO from Adamant Zacian-C 73.6% of the time.

Offensive Dragon Dance.description:
EV Spreads

  • 140 HP / 252 Atk / 116 Spe with Adamant: The Speed EVs allow Necrozma-DM to outspeed Timid Yveltal after Dragon Dance.

  • 60 HP / 252 Atk / 196 Spe with Jolly: With some bulk sacrificed, this spread allows Necrozma-DM to outspeed Marshadow and Eternatus after Dragon Dance.

Cosmic Power.description:
Items

  • Rocky Helmet: This item is Necrozma-DM's best way of dealing daamage to Zacian-C while setting up.

  • Utility Umbrella: Utility Umbrella ensures that Necrozma-DM can recover 50% of its health, even under Kyogre's rain.

Calm Mind.description:
• With this set, Necrozma-DM utilizes its great bulk and serviceable Special Attack to become a rather threatening Calm Mind sweeper.

  • Stored Power already matches Photon Geyser's Base Power after activating Weakness Policy and getting one Calm Mind boost, or after getting three Calm Mind boosts. Continually increasing its Base Power also effectively bypasses Unaware.

  • Heat Wave can be used as coverage for Ferrothorn, other Necrozma-DM, and Zacian-C.

  • This set uses Dynamax particularly well , as Stored Power becomes a 130 BP Max Mindstorm, and Max Steelspike's Defense boosts contribute to both Necrozma-DM’s survivability and Stored Power's Base Power.

Items

  • Weakness Policy is the preferred item, providing huge boosts to both Necrozma-DM's Special Attack and Stored Power's base power upon taking a super effective attack.

  • Leftovers can be used to provide some passive recovery, better conserving Necrozma-DM's limited Morning Sun PP.

  • Kee Berry also deserves a mention, as the Defense boost pairs nicely with the Special Defense boosts from Calm Mind, increasing Necrozma-DM's survivability.

  • Utility Umbrella makes setting up against Kyogre a more feasible task thanks to ignoring the impact of rain. This lets Necrozma-DM take less damage and restore 50% of it's health against Kyogre.

Marshadow.overview: This set is for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Focus Sash.description:
Natures

  • Adamant: Adamant gives Marshadow a good shot of KOing Zacian-C with Spectral Thief + Shadow Sneak after Stealth Rock damage.

  • Jolly: Jolly is useful for outspeeding Timid Lugia and slower Zacian-C.

Naganadel.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A+ Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are fantastic in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame, and can sweep, support, or wall significant portions of the metagame. These Pokemon require less support than most others to be used effectively and have few flaws that can easily be overlooked when compared to their positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Nasty Plot Sweeper.description:
• With Beast Boost boosting its Speed, Naganadel has excellent potential to sweep with Nasty Plot.

  • While Draco Meteor may seem to be a poor fit for sweeping, it gives Naganadel a powerful attack without setting up, and is useful while Dynamaxed. Dragon Pulse can be used for consistent power, however.

Items

  • Life Orb gives Naganadel the extra power it needs to sweep easily, and makes it less reliant on setting up Nasty Plot.

  • Focus Sash can give Nagandel an unexpected chance to set up Nasty Plot.

  • Lum Berry is also a handy tool against status, letting Naganadel shrug off attempts to stop a sweep with Yawn and Thunder Wave in particular.

All-out Attacker.description:
• Thanks to Beast Boost, Naganadel is fully capable of sweeping with 4 Attacks, especially while Dynamaxed.

  • Air Slash lets Nagandel boost its Speed while Dynamaxed, whch pairs perfectly with Modest variants. If hitting Heatran is a must, Thunderbolt is a reasonable alternative.

  • A Modest nature ensures that Naganadel will get a Special Attack boost after a KO, which is especially useful if using Choice Scarf or Air Slash. Timid is still useful though, because it lets Naganadel outspeed Cinderace.

Items
