  • Life Orb is Nagandel's best option for sweeping while Dynamaxed, giving Naganadel an immediate power boost.

  • Choice Scarf gives Naganadel the alternative role of revenge killing threats when not Dynamaxed, and also lets it clean weakened teams thanks to Beast Boost.

Melmetal.overview: This set is for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Trick Room Offense.description:
Items

  • Choice Band: Choice Band is best suited for late game Trick Room sweeping with Double Iron Bash.

  • Assault Vest: This patches up Melmetal's poor Special Defense, making it an extremely bulky Dynamax user.

  • Life Orb: This item is best suited when your win condition involves Melmetal usually Dynamaxing.

Rillaboom-Gmax.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are fantastic in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame, and can sweep, support, or wall significant portions of the metagame. These Pokemon require less support than most others to be used effectively and have few flaws that can easily be overlooked when compared to their positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

G-Max Choice Attacker.description:
• With a Choice Band in hand, Rillaboom becomes both a good revenge killer with Grassy Glide's priority under Grassy Terrain, and an effective scout thanks to U-turn.

  • High Horsepower lets Rillaboom demolish Heatran and blast Cinderace and Naganadel switch-ins. Wood Hammer doesn't offer any additional coverage, but deals such a massive amount of damage that it's worth the recoil.

  • Superpower is Rillaboom's best chance to deal good damage to Celesteela and Galarian Moltres, while Drain Punch is a weaker alternative that allows Rillaboom to gain some health back instead of lower power.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Spe Adamant: This spread maximizes Rillaboom's power and bulk.

  • 100 HP / 252 Atk / 156 Spe Adamant: With this EV spread, Rillaboom outspeeds up to Timid Celesteela, important if running a Fighting-type move.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe Jolly or Adamant: Maximizing Speed ensures that Rillaboom outspeeds a wide variety of offensive threats, such as Dragonite, Heatran, Metagross, and Choice Band Dracovish. While Adamant fails to always outspeed these, it does outspeed more defensive Zapdos.

G-Max General Offense.description:
• Rillaboom is still an effective revenge killer and potential scout without an offensive item.

  • Drum Beating lets Rillaboom offer valuable Speed control, particularly effective against Max Airstream switch-ins such as Galarian Moltres and Salamence. Wood Hammer is a viable alternative due to its high power.

  • U-turn provides valuable scouting and momentum-conserving potential for Rillaboom.

  • High Horsepower is ideal for dealing massive damage to Heatran.

  • Superpower is Rillaboom's best attack against Celesteela and Ferrothorn.

Items

  • Assault Vest gives Rillaboom some valuable extra special bulk, which is especially useful while Gigantamaxed.

  • Focus Sash on the other hand, lets Rillaboom surprise offensive threats it otherwise wouldn't survive against, such as Nihilego.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Spe Adamant: This spread gives Rillaboom the best combination of bulk and power.

  • 100 HP / 252 Atk / 156 Spe Adamant: When using Superpower or U-turn, this EV spread is highly recommended for outspeeding Timid Celesteela.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe Jolly or Adamant: This EV spread allows Rillaboom to outspeed a wide variety of offensive threats, such as Dragonite, Heatran, Metagross, and Choice Band Dracovish, allowing Rillaboom to get an important hit in before getting KOed. Adamant can be used if only outspeeding defensive Zapdos is needed.

G-Max Swords Dance Sweeper.description:
• With Grassy Glide being such a strong priority attack, Rillaboom can make for an effective late-game cleaner, especially with its powerful Gigantamax forme.

  • Rillaboom should carry a Fighting-type attack to hit Celesteela as hard as possible and provide additional means to boost Attack while Gigantamaxed. Superpower deals the most one-time damage to Celesteela, but Drain Punch is a more consistent option against bulky threats.

  • Knock Off is Rillaboom's strongest attack against Dragapult, and removing items is very valuable.

  • High Horsepower not only crushes Heatran, but provides a useful Special Defense boost as Max Quake.

  • Acrobatics pairs well with Grassy Seed for decent coverage, and becomes the dangerous Max Airstream while Gigantamaxed.

Items

  • Grassy Seed's Defense boost gives Rillaboom an easier time setting up Swords Dance late-game.

  • Focus Sash lets Rillaboom set up Swords Dance against unexpected foes.

EV Spreads

  • 100 HP / 252 Atk / 156 Spe Adamant: This spread ensures that Rillaboom outspeeds Timid Celesteela while still giving it decent bulk if it's unable to set up Swords Dance.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe Jolly: Maximizing Speed lets Rillaboom outspeed some valuable targets such as Dragonite, Gyarados, and Metagross, increasing its potential to sweep late-game in exchange for less bulk for general use.

Cinderace-Gmax.overview:
Viability Ranking: S Rank

Reserved for the best Pokemon in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon are usually able to perform a variety of roles effectively, or can just do one extremely well. Their use has low risk involved and high reward exerted. Pokemon in this rank have very few flaws that are patched up by numerous positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Gmax Libero.description:
• Gigantamax Libero Cinderace serves as a fast multi-faceted wallbreaker and sweeper with access to a plethora of powerful STAB coverage options.

  • Pyro Ball, High Jump Kick, and Bounce are all required when Dynamaxed to help Cinderace become incredibly difficult to handle via immense damage output and boosting Attack and Speed while Dynamaxed

  • For the fourth slot, Sucker Punch gives Cinderace access to powerful priority, allowing it to check many variants of Dragapult, while Zen Headbutt gives Cinderace the ability to hit Toxapex well while also potentially setting up Psychic Terrain to avoid getting revenge killed by priority attacks. Iron Head and Gunk shot are options to make Cinderace an effective Fairy-type check.

  • Life Orb is the standard item of choice, giving Cinderace immense damage output, and is often worth the small recoil damage, as it allows Cinderace to OHKO much of the metagame. Assault Vest improves Cinderace’s matchup against special attackers, and takes advantage of the fact it only uses attacking options.

Sash.description:
• Cinderace is an effective revenge killer when sporting a Focus Sash, allowing it to Counter against physical Dynamax threats, as well as get an extra opportunity to attack through surviving solo hits at 1 HP.

  • Sucker Punch can be used right after Counter KOs a physical Dynamax attacker in order to chip revenge killers when brought down to 1 HP. High Jump Kick can be considered over Counter or Sucker Punch in order to improve the matchup against Porygon2 and Tyranitar, reducing the passiveness of sashed Cinderace.

  • For the last slot, Gunk Shot and Iron Head allow Cinderace to effectively check Fairy-types like Tapu Fini or Mimikyu, but can also be used for Counter if both Sucker Punch and High Jump Kick are opted for.

Gmax Choice.description:
• High Jump Kick is required on a Choice-locked set, being Cinderace's most effective high-damage move. U-turn is always needed for Choice Item Cinderace, allowing it to pivot out of bad matchups and scouting opposing Pokemon without committing to a Choice lock. Pyro Ball is an effective coverage complement, and allows access to Gmax Fireball when Dynamaxed.

  • For the last slot, either Gunk Shot or Iron Head can be used, dramatically improving Cinderace's matchup against the likes of Tapu Fini. Alternatively, although Sucker Punch faces awkwardness with the Choice lock, it can still be considered to improve the matchup against Dragapult and for revenge killing.

SUPER STRIKER (Gigantamax Attacker).description:
• With its great Attack, Speed, and Libero, Cinderace finds itself in a commanding position in the BSS metagame.

  • Pyro Ball becomes G-Max Fireball under Gigantamax, a 160-Base Power attack that also nullifies abilities like Mimikyu's Disguise and Heatran's Flash Fire.

  • Bounce gives Cinderace access to Max Airstream, which makes it a very potent sweeper, having nearly unmatched Speed alongside its colorful movepool and Libero.

  • Sucker Punch may seem odd on a set revolving around Max Airstream, but it can be useful in situations where Cinderace doesn't have a boost, such as revenge killing.

  • Giga Impact provides Cinderace with an obscenely powerful Max Strike, which is useful for both its wide neutral coverage and the Speed drop, which lets it maintain the Speed advantage in Dynamax battles against Zapdos without relying on Max Airstream. Max Strike is also Cinderace's strongest option against Quagsire.

  • Gunk Shot grants valuable coverage against Fairy-types such as Xerneas and Tapu Fini.

  • Iron Head still covers Xerneas while giving Cinderace access to Max Steelspike for Defense boosts.

Items

  • Life Orb elevates Cinderace's damage output even further, making it extremely difficult to wall.

  • Assault Vest grants Cinderace some extra survivability, potentially allowing it to get a crucial second hit off against Pokemon like Zapdos.

Focus Sash.description:
• Focus Sash Cinderace makes for a powerful general attacker and great lead, starting most games off with a bang.

  • High Jump Kick is Cinderace's strongest attack outside of Dynamax.

  • Counter and Focus Sash allow Cinderace to trade KOs with physical threats such as Zacian-C, Urshifu-S, and Landorus-T, potentially removing them from the game immediately.

  • Sucker Punch provides powerful priority, picking off weakened targets such as Calyrex-S.

  • Gunk Shot provides valuable coverage against Xerneas and Tapu Fini. Iron Head still hits Xerneas supper effectively, but it sacrifices damage against Tapu Fini for the chance to cause foes to flinch so that Cinderace can then KO them.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Choice Scarf Cinderace can use its fantastic Speed to be a great pivot and terrifying revenge killer.

  • Thanks to Cinderace's very high natural Speed, Choice Scarf lets it prevent Ditto from reverse sweeping after copying fast foes like bulky Zacian-C.

  • High Jump Kick is Cinderace's strongest attack outside of Dynamax.

  • Gunk Shot provides valuable coverage against Fairy-types, namely Xerneas and Tapu Fini.

  • Iron Head provides more accurate coverage on Xerneas and a potentially useful flinch chance to bring foes into KO range, but it sacrifices a lot of damage.

  • While Sucker Punch may seem odd on a Choice Scarf set, the coverage against Calyrex-S is extremely valuable, especially against Choice Scarf variants and certain other Speed-boosted Pokemon, which outspeed even Choice Scarf Cinderace.

Corviknight.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Physically Defensive.description:
• When running maximum Defense investment alongside Iron Defense, Corviknight is a good physical wall that has several tools to differentiate itself from Celesteela, such as Roost.

  • Body Press alongside Iron Defense makes Corviknight very difficult to defeat with physical attacks following a boost and allows it to deal incredibly high damage with Body Press following Defense boosts.

  • Brave Bird allows Corviknight to hit Ghost-types and boost its Speed with Max Airstream, but Iron Head can be used to help ease the matchup against Swords Dance Mimikyu. Taunt can also be run here to stop status moves like Yawn, but this leaves Corviknight unable to damage Ghost-types.

  • Avoid using Dynamax on Corviknight unless it needs it to survive hits in a pinch, such as switching in against a boosted Mimikyu. Corviknight will lose the massive damage output from Iron Defense-boosted Body Press, and its damage output is tame against any Pokemon with decent defenses.

  • Mirror Armor is preferred over Pressure in order to survive against Max Phantasm Defense drops, allowing Corviknight to effectively defeat standard Mimikyu and physical Dragapult sets. This also punishes Intimidate Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Salamence, and Gyarados

Items

  • Sitrus Berry is the primary item, which helps Corviknight avoid many 2HKOs, such as Cinderace's Pyro Ball.

  • Leftovers can be used for long-term health recovery if that is preferred.

  • Rocky Helmet can be used for chip damage in matchups such as against Urshifu-R.

Specially Defensive.description:
• Near-maximum special bulk and Maranga Berry allow Corviknight to consistently survive weaker super effective attacks and set up on Pokemon that would otherwise check it.

  • Taunt is the more traditional option for shutting down passive Pokemon, but Substitute can be used for stalling out PP more effectively or setting up on weak special attacks.

  • Pressure is the preferred ability to stall out weak super effective special attacks, but Mirror Armor can still be useful to help against Intimidate users, Mystical Fire attackers, and Max Phantasm users.

  • Dynamax allows Corviknight to survive otherwise lethal hits and can be used to sweep after Bulk Up boosts have been accumulated.

  • The given EV spread is designed to be as specially bulky as possible while still being able to outspeed defensive Celesteela and Iron Defense Corviknight sets to Taunt them.

Fast Taunt.description:
• This Corviknight set takes advantage of its relatively good natural bulk, Speed investment, and Bulk Up to outspeed the majority of bulky metagame options to take advantage of passive foes and opposing Corviknight to sweep opposing teams with boosted Brave Bird or Max Airstream.

  • Taunt is used to shut down status and boosting moves, allowing Corviknight to gain an advantage over slower Pokemon that have trouble damaging it. such as Hippowdon and Ferrothorn.

  • Substitute can be used to gain an advantage over status users while also easing prediction against foes switching out.

  • This Corviknight wants to Dynamax after setting up Bulk Up and when its natural checks, such as Rotom forms, are removed from the game or severely damaged. Following Speed boosts from Max Airstream, Corviknight becomes difficult to deal with for offensively oriented teams, as it will outspeed most Choice Scarf users at +2 Speed.

  • Mirror Armor is used to help beat Mimikyu one-on-one, outspeeding it after a Max Airstream and reversing Defense drops from Max Phantasm. It also let Corviknight punish Intimidate Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Salamence, and Gyarados.

Items

  • Lum Berry is used with Taunt generally to allow Corviknight to switch into moves such as Yawn, breaking Stealth Rock + Yawn cycles.

  • Leftovers is generally used in combination with Substitute, to gain passive health while being protected by Substitute.

EV Spreads

  • 108 HP / 148 Atk / 252 Spe with a Jolly nature: Maximum Speed allows this Corviknight to effectively Taunt all Corviknight while still having decent attacking power and health through partial investment in Attack and HP. It also can outspeed Jolly Cinderace at +1 Speed.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with a Jolly nature: This is a simple spread to maximize HP and Speed; it also lets Corviknight outspeed everything up to Jolly Cinderace at +1 Speed and survive hits better than the 148 Attack spread.

  • 252 HP / 60 Atk / 196 Spe with an Adamant nature: This EV spread allows Corviknight to outspeed positive-natured base 100 Speed Pokemon after a Max Airstream.

Weakness Policy.description:
• This Corviknight set is designed to bait in super effective attacks, using the combination of Dynamax and Corviknight's superb natural bulk to easily survive these attacks and hit back lethally with Max Airstream.

  • Bulk Up is the boosting move of choice, allowing Corviknight to augment its Attack when not in Dynamax forme, allowing it to hit harder and making it more difficult to take down with physical attacks.

  • Iron Head gives Corviknight a great chance to OHKO Dynamax Togekiss with Max Steelspike after Weakness Policy is activated.

  • Power Trip can be used to deal massive damage following Dynamax expiring through stat boost accumulation.

  • Body Press gives Attack boosts with Max Knuckle and allows Corviknight to hit Steel-types more effectively than other options.

  • Taunt allows you to stifle slower status moves, allowing Corviknight to set up on passive Pokemon.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with a Jolly nature: This is a simple spread to maximize HP and Speed; it also allows Corviknight to outspeed everything up to Jolly Cinderace at +1 Speed and survive hits better than the spreads invested in Attack.

  • 252 HP / 100 Atk / 156 Spe with an Adamant nature: These EVs are designed to outspeed positive-natured Dragapult after two Max Airstreams.

Grimmsnarl.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Dual Screens.description:
• With access to Prankster, Grimmsnarl is a good choice for setting up Reflect and Light Screen.

  • Spirit Break ensures that Grimmsnarl isn't made totally helpless by Taunt, in addition to lowering the Special Attack of foes.

  • Taunt lets Grimmsnarl punish passive leads such as Hippowdon, while Thunder Wave lets Grimmsnarl cripple sweepers as long as they aren't Electric-, Ground-, or Dark-type. Sucker Punch gives Grimmsnarl a priority attack it can use before it goes down, potentially getting rid of Focus Sash on its foes.

  • The given EV spread maximizes Grimmsnarl's physical bulk, giving it a better chance of setting up both Reflect and Light Screen. Adamant with maximum Attack investment is another option for powering up Spirit Break and Sucker Punch.

  • Consider pairing Grimmsnarl with Pokemon that benefit from dual screens. Good sweepers to consider include Galarian Moltres, Glastrier, and Metagross.

Items

  • Light Clay is the obvious choice for keeping Reflect and Light Screen up for 8 turns.

  • When equipped with a Lagging Tail, Grimmsnarl can use Trick to ruin sweepers that aren't Dark-type, notably ruining targets Thunder Wave couldn't such as Zapdos and Raikou.

Dracovish.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Choice Attacker.description:
• With a boost from Strong Jaw and moving first, Fishous Rend turns Dracovish into a good wallbreaker that hits major threats hard, such as Hippowdon and Landorus-T.

  • Most of the other attacks are filler. Outrage hits Dragon-types hard, Psychic Fangs breaks Reflect and Light Screen, and Low Kick does good damage to Ferrothorn and grants Dracovish access to Max Knuckle if it's forced to Dynamax. Ice Fang hits Landorus-T, Rillaboom, and Dragonite harder than any of Dracovish's other moves if it's forced to Dynamax.

  • Sleep Talk deserves special mention for letting Dracovish absorb the Sleep status, letting it effectively take Yawn from the likes of Swampert and Hippowdon. Optionally, Dracovish can run Fishous Rend and Sleep Talk as its only two moves to increase its sleep absorption capability.

  • Sand Rush is an option for Choice Band Dracovish to outspeed foes it normally wouldn't, such as Dragapult and Choice Scarf Landorus-T. Just note that this requires more support and reduces Dracovish's wallbreaking power.

Items

  • With a Choice Scarf and a Jolly nature, Dracovish outspeeds up to base 130 Speed threats, such as Tapu Koko. This allows Dracovish to do decently well against offensive teams, though note that Dracovish still fails to outspeed Dragapult.

  • With a Choice Band and an Adamant nature, Dracovish becomes a powerful wallbreaker, with Fishous Rend 2HKOing even defensive Tapu Fini.

Dragapult.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A+ Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are fantastic in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame, and can sweep, support, or wall significant portions of the metagame. These Pokemon require less support than most others to be used effectively and have few flaws that can easily be overlooked when compared to their positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Physical Attacker.description:
• Dragapult may have a shallow physical movepool, but its Speed and good STAB moves still make it a dangerous foe.

  • Phantom Force may seem like a strange choice, but few Pokemon resist Ghost-type attacks, and it can also be used to stall out Dynamax turns.

  • U-turn makes Dragapult a good pivot, while Sucker Punch lets Dragapult pick off weakened faster Pokemon.

  • Dragon Dance lets Dragapult outspeed almost any threat, making it a good sweeper at certain times. Will-O-Wisp can make for a surprising move that cripples Dragapult's physical foes, punishing Sucker Punch Cinderace in particular if it has already changed types with Libero. Thunder Wave is also an acceptable option for crippling faster foes, which works especially well with Focus Sash.

  • Inflitrator is a wonderful ability, allowing Dragapult to ignore Substitutes, and both Reflect and Light Screen. Clear Body still has merit, ensuring Intimidate Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Salamence, and Gyarados can't cut your Attack.

  • Jolly is the prefered nature for outspeeding up to Adamant Pheromosa, Timid Tapu Koko, and Choice Scarf Dracovish. Adamant doesn't outpeed these three threats, but in exchange Dragapult gets extra power while still outspeeding Timid Naganadel. It's also the prefered nature for Choice Scarf Dragapult.

Items

  • Life Orb gives Dragapult the most versatility for sweeping late-game, especially if it Dynamaxes.

  • Focus Sash works well with Dragon Dance, giving Dragapult a near guaranteed chance to set up.

  • Choice Scarf may seem absurd with Dragapult's Speed, but it lets Dragapult outspeed important Choice Scarf threats such as Landorus-T and Naganadel.

  • Choice Band is also an acceptable item for increased damage output, and pairs well with U-turn.

Special Attacker.description:
• Dragapult's Special Attack stat may not be impressive, but its coverage is good enough for it to be a good, speedy Special Attacker.

  • Thunderbolt is Dragapult's most damaging move against Tapu Fini, making it highly recommended.

  • Fire Blast roasts Ferrothorn, and does plenty of damage to Celesteela. U-turn lets Dragapult function as a decent pivot and scout despite it being weak. Will-O-Wisp can catch foes such as Weakness Policy Metagross off guard. Thunder Wave, when paired with a Focus Sash, can effectively cripple speedy sweepers.

  • Timid is the prefered nature, to outspeed Adamant Pheromosa, Tapu Koko, and Choice Scarf Dracovish. A Modest nature is still acceptable if more power is needed though, as it still outspeeds Timid Naganadel. Modest is particularly best for Choice Scarf sets.

Items

  • Life Orb is Dragapult's best option for damage output, especially if it Dynamaxes.

  • Choice Scarf may seem odd, but it allows Dragapult to outspeed key threat such as Pheromosa and Choice Scarf Landorus-T.

  • Choice Specs is Dragapult's most powerful item when not Dynamaxed.

  • Focus Sash can surprise particularly powerful foes such as Cinderace.

Dual Screens.description:
• With Curse to inflict on its foes and sacrifice itself quickly, Dragapult makes a unique and speedy setter of Reflect and Light Screen.

  • Dragon Darts is recommended for OHKOing Modest Pheromosa. Shadow Ball however, will hit Fairy-types such as Mimikyu if needed. Although going without attacks is risky, Thunder Wave can cripple Pokemon that attempt to set up on Dragapult, such as Cinderace and Galarian Moltres.

  • Inflitrator is usually best in case Dragapult comes across a Substitute using foe or opposing screens, but Cursed Body can potentially punish attacking foes as Dragapult sets up screens. Note that Curse will ignore Substitute regardless of Dragapult's ability.

EV Spreads

  • 196 HP / 44 Atk / 4 Def / 12 SpD / 252 Spe with Jolly: This spread ensures Dragapult OHKOs Pheromosa with Dragon Darts, and avoids a Special Attack boost from Porygon2.

  • 252 HP / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: If not using physical attacks, use this spread to maximize Dragapult's Speed and bulk.

Dynamax Sweeper.description:
• Dragapult makes for a fairly effective Dynamax sweeper. This is in large part thanks to Steel Wing, which turns into the valuable Max Steelspike, which with Max Wyrmwind's Attack lowering, is perfect for getting Weakness Policy activated.

  • Phantom Force turns into a powerful Max Phantasm when Dynamaxed, and is also useful for stalling out opposing Dynamax turns later.

  • Dragon Dance makes Dragapult less reliant on Dynamaxing to sweep, making it a great back-up option for sweeping. Fly on the other hand, is for going all in on Dynamax, allowing Dragapult to boost its Speed with Max Airstream.

  • Clear Body is the prefered ability for Dragapult, ensuring that Intimidate doesn't ruin its hard work. Infilitrator is still a good alternative though, in case certain Substitute Pokemon or dual screens are problematic for your team.

EV Spreads

  • 164 HP / 236 Atk / 4 Def / 12 SpD / 92 Spe with Jolly: This spread allows Dragapult to outspeed Timid Naganadel, while having enough bulk to survive Life Orb Cinderace's Max Darkness while Dynamaxed. The Special Defense EVs ensure that Porygon2 does not get a Special Attack boost from Download.

  • 252 Atk / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Jolly: This Dragapult maximizes its Speed so it can outpace Tapu Koko and Adamant Pheromosa, at the cost of bulk.

Bulky Substitute.description:
• Dragapult's impressive Speed stat means it can effectively stall out Dynamax turns against bulkier Dynamaxers, such as Metagross and Glastrier.

  • Will-O-Wisp is the best support option for punishing physical Pokemon, and it goes well with the Leftovers that keep Dragapult healthy. However, Thunder Wave is notable for crippling Pokemon that don't fear being burned, such as Galarian Moltres and Blaziken.

  • The given EV spread allows Dragapult to outpeed up to Adamant Pheromosa, while giving Dragapult maximum recovery from Leftovers. The Attack investment is enough to OHKO Pheromosa with Dragon Darts, and even OHKO Moxie Salamence. The 4 Special Defense EVs prevent Porygon2 from gaining a Special Attack boost from Download, meaning the unaccounted for extra 4 EVs may go anywhere but Defense.

Eternatus.overview: These sets are for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Defensive.description:
EV Spreads

  • 244 HP / 228 Def / 36 Spe: This physically bulky spread outspeeds Palkia and Garchomp.

  • 244 HP / 4 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe: This maximizes Eternatus's Speed and bulk, allowing it to at least Speed tie with offensive Eternatus.

Offensive.description:
Items

  • Power Herb: This allows Eternatus to boost its Special Attack with Meteor Beam, which is also deals massive damage to Ho-Oh.

  • Life Orb: When using Recover, Life Orb is the best offensive item for Eternatus.

EV Spreads

  • 76 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 172 Spe with Modest: With this spread, Eternatus OHKOes offensive Yveltal with a +1 Dynamax Cannon after Stealth Rock damage, and outspeeds both Palkia and Garchomp. 4 Defense EVs can be removed to deal with Porygon2's Download better, but it's not a particularly common Pokemon.

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This spread maximizes Eternatus's Speed, letting it outspeed Jolly Marshadow and Speed tie with Adamant Zacian-C.

Choice Item Attacker.description:
Items

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs Eternatus slices through Dynamax foes, being able to OHKO offensive Yveltal after Stealth Rock damage with Dynamax Cannon in particular.

  • Choice Scarf With Choice Scarf, Eternatus becomes an effective revenge killer of several Dragon-types, such as Zekrom and Palkia.

EV Spreads

  • 76 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 172 Spe with Modest: The Speed investment outpaces Palkia and Garchomp. If the rare Porygon2 poses an issue, the 4 Defense EVs can be removed to avoid a Download boost.

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: With maximum Speed investment, Eternatus can now outspeed Jolly Marshadow and Timid Lugia, and speed tie with Adamant Zacian-C at worst.

Urshifu-Gmax.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A+ Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Choice Item.description:
• Urshifu-S, when equipped with a Choice Item, becomes a potent physical wallbreaking option through its fantastic dual STAB combination. It is also difficult for foes to scout its Choice-locked move with Protect due to Unseen Fist.

  • Wicked Blow is a tremendous wallbreaking move, with its guaranteed critical hit making it very difficult to set-up on or switch into.

  • Close Combat works in concert with Wicked Blow, covering opposing Dark- and Fighting-types that can otherwise tank Wicked Blow.

  • Sucker Punch, while sometimes awkward when Choice-locked, gives Urshifu-S a potent priority option which does significant damage to Pokemon while holding a Choice Band. U-turn can be opted for instead to maintain momentum when Choice-locked.

  • Iron Head gives Urshifu-S a reasonable attack against Fairy-types, which are otherwise a natural counter to it. Poison Jab or Thunder Punch can be used instead, which also hits Tapu Fini super effectively, while also powerfully hitting Pokemon like Rillaboom and Gyarados, respectively.

  • A Jolly nature is important to outspeed Mimikyu, while an Adamant nature makes Urshifu-S even more difficult for physical walls to take consecutive hits.

  • Despite Choice item Urshifu-S rarely activating Gigantamax, the Gigantamax forme is still chosen to gain access to G-Max One Blow to go through opposing Max Guard, which is more useful than a Special Defense drop from Max Darkness.

Items

  • A Choice Band helps Urshifu-S become a potent wallbreaker, 2HKOing the likes of Toxapex and defensive Celesteela and eliminating virtually all switch-ins that do not resist it.

  • A Choice Scarf allows Urshifu-S to get the jump on fast foes such as Cinderace and Dragapult.

Focus Sash.description:
• Urshifu-S equipped with a Focus Sash is top notch at winning one-on-one situations, effectively beating most physical attackers with Focus Sash intact and dealing immense damage to subsequent Pokemon before fainting.

  • Wicked Blow guarantees a critical hit against the receiver, making it a particularly good option against Pokemon attempting to wall Urshifu-S with Defense boosts.

  • Counter is a useful move for Urshifu-S, allowing it to defeat Dynamax Landorus-T, Gigantamax Cinderace, and other physical Dynamax sweepers if it keeps Focus Sash intact.

  • Sucker Punch allows Urshifu-S to deal damage against faster foes that could deal lethal damage.

  • Finally, Close Combat allows Urshifu-S to check the likes of Snorlax and Porygon2, and is a good complementary STAB move alongside Wicked Blow.

  • A Jolly nature is chosen to outspeed Jolly Mimikyu.

  • An Adamant nature can be opted for if you wish to deal greater amounts of damage at the expense of its otherwise effective Speed tier.

  • Gigantamax Urshifu-S is generally chosen to gain access to G-Max One Blow, a Max Move that goes through opposing Max Guard, which is more useful than a Special Defense drop that Max Darkness would otherwise give.

BEAR KNUCKLE (Choice Item Attacker).description:
• Wicked Blow is Urshifu-S's main attack, with the guaranteed critical hit providing extreme damage and bypassing Defense boosts or Attack drops

  • Sucker Punch is powerful priority to pick off weakened, faster targets such as Regieleki, boosted Necrozma-DM, and especially Calyrex-S.

  • U-turn is useful for Urshifu-S to effectively scout its switch-ins and maintain momentum for its team.

  • Aerial Ace provides access to Max Airstream to boost Urshifu-S’s Speed, potentially allowing it to sweep faster, frailer teams. Max Airstream also can deny Eternatus the chance to recover against Urshifu-S and stall its Wicked Blow PP.

  • Stone Edge is useful coverage against Ho-Oh, Yveltal and other Flying-types that could potentially survive Wicked Blow and KO Urshifu-S in return.

  • Thunder Punch hits Tapu Fini super effectively in addition to most Flying-types, but it sacrifices some damage against Ho-Oh and Zapdos.

  • Ice Punch can be used to heavily damage targets like Landorus-T and Zygarde while still hitting Yveltal and Zapdos super effectively.

  • Sleep Talk is a niche but effective pick that allows Urshifu-S to absorb sleep from the likes of Hippowdon and Quagsire while maintaining effectiveness; however, Sucker Punch will fail if called by Sleep Talk when Urshifu-S moves last, so it is not advised to use these moves on the same set.

  • If running Choice Band, an Adamant nature is worth considering. While Urshifu-S will no longer outspeed key threats such as Kyogre, Landorus-T, and Mimikyu, the extra power can be very helpful against bulkier teams.

  • Gigantamax is preferred over Dynamax thanks to G-Max One Blow’s ability to ignore Max Guard.

Items

  • Choice Band provides Urshifu-S with absurd power, allowing Wicked Blow to easily 2HKO the likes of Toxapex and Quagsire, and even some resistant Pokémon like Yveltal. Additionally, very few Pokemon can stall out this set, making it particularly effective against stall teams.

  • Choice Scarf lets Urshifu-S outspeed usually-faster targets, letting it revenge kill or grab a surprise KO, securing your team an early lead.

Urshifu-Rapid-Strike.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A- Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are fantastic in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame, and can sweep, support, or wall significant portions of the metagame. These Pokemon require less support than most others to be used effectively and have few flaws that can easily be overlooked when compared to their positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Focus Sash.description:
• This Urshifu-R does a great job of checking Dynamaxed physical threats such as Cinderace and Landorus-T, with Counter taking care of them as long as Focus Sash is intact.

  • Close Combat's power makes it a great complementary STAB move with Surging Strikes.

  • Aqua Jet's priority ensures that even Focus Sash foes that survive Counter will usually lose the matchup.

  • Surging Strikes is not only Urshifu-R's strongest Water-type STAB attack, but it also lets Urshifu-R break through Focus Sash and ignore Intimidate Attack drops.

Choice Attacker.description:
• Surging Strikes is a powerful STAB attack that lets Urshifu-R blast through Focus Sash Pokemon and ignore Intimidate.

  • Despite its good physical bulk, Urshifu-R prefers to maximize its damage with a STAB Close Combat.

  • Thunder Punch is Urshifu-R's best hope against Tapu Fini and Gyarados.

  • U-turn is great for pivoting while also enhancing Urshifu-R's lead potential.

  • Aqua Jet is useful for picking off weakened threats when using the Choice Band set.

  • Aerial Ace ensures that Urshifu-R can increase its Speed while Dynamaxed with Max Airstream.

Items

  • Choice Scarf lets Urshifu-R perform better against Cinderace and Choice Scarf Landorus-T, and is a good revenge killer in general.

  • Choice Band gives Urshifu-R a huge boost in power, being able to OHKO offensive Mimikyu and Dynamaxed offensive Landorus-T with Surging Strikes.

4 Attacks Dynamax User.description:
• With Aerial Ace, Urshifu-R can be a threatening Dynamax attacker thanks to Max Airstream's Speed boost. Acrobatics can be used instead if using Weakness Policy, for a stronger attack against Grass-types after Weakness Policy is consumed.

  • This Urshifu-R is focused on sweeping, so Close Combat's power is worth it despite the Defense drop.

  • Surging Strikes is useful for busting through Focus Sash and ignoring Intimidate.

  • Thunder Punch is needed for Urshifu to have a fighting chance against Tapu Fini and Gyarados.

  • Iron Head's Defense boost as Max Steelspike is great for surviving against physical threats like Life Orb Mimikyu and works particularly well with Weakness Policy.

  • Both Dynamax and Gigantamax formes of Urshifu-R are viable. With just Dynamax, Urshifu-R can further boost the power of its Water-type attacks with the Rain set up from Max Geyser. However, Gigantamax Urshifu-R can ruin Max Guard stalling tactics with G-Max Rapid Flow.

Items

  • Weakness Policy takes advantage of Urshifu-R's many weaknesses while Dynamaxed

  • Life Orb's power boost makes Urshifu-R more useful when not Dynamaxed.

Regieleki.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are fantastic in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame, and can sweep, support, or wall significant portions of the metagame. These Pokemon require less support than most others to be used effectively and have few flaws that can easily be overlooked when compared to their positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Dual Screens.description:
• Regieleki's absurd Speed stat and access to Explosion makes it an ideal choice for setting up Reflect and Light Screen.

  • Volt Switch lets Regieleki become a decent scout, while Thunderbolt has the most consistent damage output. Wild Charge can be used with maximum Attack investment for a more powerful Explosion.

  • Make sure to pair this Regieleki with powerful sweepers that benefit from dual screens, such as Galarian Moltres and Glastrier.

EV Spreads

  • Regieleki has many different benchmarks to go for. At minimum, all EV spreads will avoid a Special Attack boost from Porygon2's Download.

  • 148 HP / 4 Atk / 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 100 Spe with Timid or Jolly: This EV spread allows Regieleki to outspeed up to +1 Nihilego. If using Wild Charge, invest in Attack instead of Special Attack.

  • 92 HP / 68 Def / 252 Spa / 76 SpD / 20 Spe with Timid or Jolly: This EV spread allows Regieleki to survive Jolly Landorus-T's Earthquake after Reflect is set up, while still outspeeding up to Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. If using Wild Charge, use a Jolly nature and Attack investment.

  • 116 HP / 116 Def / 132 SpA / 124 SpD / 20 Spe with Timid or Jolly: This EV spread will survive Adamant Landorus-T Earthquake after a Reflect, while outspeeding up to Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. Use Jolly and Attack investment if using Wild Charge.

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest or Adamant: This EV spread allows Regieleki to outspeed up to +1 base 100 Speed Pokemon, such as Salamence, while maximizing its power. Use Adamant and Attack investment for Wild Charge.

Special Attacker.description:
• Transistor and its insane Speed make Regieleki a fearsome late-game cleaner once Ground-types are sufficently weakened.

  • Hyper Beam is a very risky move, but it's Regieleki's best shot at dealing serious damage to Landorus-T and Hippowdon, and makes for a powerful Max Strike while Dynamaxed.

  • Ancient Power allows Regieleki to 2HKO Thundurus-T without relying on Max Strike.

  • Rising Voltage can be used to have a more powerful Max Lighting, and deal massive damage to grounded targets under Electric Terrain.

Items

  • Choice Specs makes Regieleki a powerful late-game cleaner without much hassle to use.

  • Life Orb makes Regieleki more suited towards Dynamax sweeping,

  • Magnet is a viable alternative if a different Pokemon is holding Life Orb.

EV Spreads

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest: This EV spread allows Regieleki to outspeed up to +1 Base 100 Speed Pokemon such as Salamence, prevents Porygon2 from getting a Special Attack boost from Download, and maximizes Regieleki's Special Attack.

  • 148 HP / 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 100 Spe with Timid: This spread allows Regieleki to outspeed up to +1 Speed Nihilego. The leftover 4 EVs can be put anywhere but Defense, as this will boost Porygon2's Special Attack with Download.

Glastrier.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A+ Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are fantastic in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame, and can sweep, support, or wall significant portions of the metagame. These Pokemon require less support than most others to be used effectively and have few flaws that can easily be overlooked when compared to their positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Chilling Dynamax Sweeper.description:
• Glastrier's insane bulk, power, and Chilling Neigh make it a fearsome Dynamax sweeper, especially under Trick Room.

  • Icicle Spear breaks through Focus Sash and Disguise, making it the ideal STAB once Dynamax has run out. Icicle Crash deals more consistent damage outside of Dynamax, and can flinch foes under Trick Room or with Custap Berry.

  • Heavy Slam gives Glastrier access to the valuable Max Steelspike while Dynamaxed.

  • Endure can be useful when used with Custap Berry to give Glastrier one priority attack.

  • Glastrier becomes a far more deadly Pokemon when it has Trick Room support. Cresselia is the best choice for this, since it can use Lunar Dance to give Glastrier another chance to sweep through teams, and even let it Dynamax early. Mimikyu and Porygon2 are also good users of Trick Room.

Items

  • Weakness Policy pairs perfectly with Dynamax, giving Glastrier another way to sweep teams.

  • Custap Berry can make revenge killing Glastrier extra difficult when it's low on health, giving it one attack with higher priority.

  • Assault Vest makes Glastrier even more difficult to take down on the special side, and pairs especially well with Dynamax.

  • Lum Berry can be paired with Swords Dance to severly punish Yawn leads such as Hippowdon and Swampert, and also to worry less about common Will-O-Wisp users such as Rotom-W.

Spectrier.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

Ghost Rider.description:
• Spectrier serves as a fragile but potent offensive sweeper, utilizing a very easily spammed Shadow Ball STAB option, high Speed tier, and Grim Neigh to overwhelm defensively oriented teams.

  • Hyper Beam and Dark Pulse help Spectrier break through Normal-type Pokemon, and have the added bonus of dropping Speed and Special Defense, respectively, when Dynamaxed.

  • Will-O-Wisp and Mud Shot allow Spectrier to provide surprisingly good support for teammates, as opponents need to respect Spectrier's offensive capabilities, leaving them vulnerable the two crippling moves.

  • Substitute or Taunt are also great options for helping Spectrier take advantage of passive Pokemon, allowing it to setup Nasty Plot against unsuspecting foes.

Items

  • Life Orb maximizes Spectrier's power, and puts less pressure on it needing to set up Nasty Plot to sweep.

  • Spell Tag is a decent alternative if Life Orb is used by another Pokemon on your team.

  • Lum Berry gives Spectrier an alternate means to set up on more passive Pokemon, such as Hippowdon and Swampert.

EV Spreads

  • 36 Def / 252 SpA / 220 Spe Timid: Allows Spectrier to outspeed 252 EV invested neutral Dragapult while gaining a bit more physical bulk to take advantage of burned foes.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Spectrier runs a fairly simple Choice Scarf set, using its top Speed tier in order to revenge kill and snowball against opponents with its Grim Neigh boosts.

  • Hyper Beam is usually picked to increase damage output, but Uproar can also be opted for to avoid a turn cooldown when not Dynamaxed and avoid falling asleep.

  • Dark Pulse allows Spectrier to drop foes' Special Defense when Dynamaxed, Will-O-Wisp lets Spectrier serve as an emergency control against physical sweepers while also providing a Max Guard option, and Mud Shot allows Spectrier provide Speed control while also boosting its own Special Defense with Max Quake.

Calyrex-Ice.overview: These sets are for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Calyrex-Shadow.overview: These sets are for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

Choice Scarf.description:
EV Spreads

  • 124 HP / 220 Def / 100 SpA / 60 Spe with Modest: This EV spread allows Calyrex-S to survive Adamant Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade while outspeeding +1 Timid Lugia.

  • 4 Def / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: Maximizing Speed is useful for letting Calyrex-S outspeed threats such as +2 Xerneas, and dealing with the many potential speed ties.
